loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es:
Herminia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 9 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de jugo natural de linaza.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y la manufactura, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Herminia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro en el quinto lugar de la fila, iniciando del lado izquierdo, viste pollera , con  una chompa color crema y mandil morado y blanco a cuadros). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ayudar con los gstos económicos a su familia la llevo a buscar una segunda actividad laboral y formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de productos de aseo personal, venta de verduras, venta de artículos de librería, venta de comida, venta de desayunos, venta de ropa de segunda mano y transporte público como mototaxi, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de jugos de linaza. La linaza es la semilla de la planta del lino; su forma de preparación consiste en; colocar la linaza molida en un recipiente, agrega  1 ½ taza de agua hirviendo y lo revuelve con una cuchara, agrega jugo de limón y deja reposar para agregarle azucar, para luego llenar su termo y realizar la venta. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante a comerciantes y vendedores de puesto fijo que son sus clientes constantes. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, conozco el mercado y sus necesidades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja son los cambios climáticos porque debe ambular hasta encontrar a sus clientes. Su sueño es abrir otro negocio de venta de comida para trabajar por las noches, ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito para la venta de pollo frito. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Herminia solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito para vender pollo frito por las noches y contar con 2 actividades.
texts.en:
Herminia is a 33 year old woman. She is married and has 2 sons, aged 9 and 18. Her business is selling organic flax seed juice. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, stable, has a good attitude, responsible and very hard working. She runs her business in the southern part of the city. It is an area characterized by informal businesses and manufacturing. It has a climate that varies during the day between 18-25 degrees celsius.

Herminia has dark skin, long black hair that she wears braided, brown eyes, short stature, and a medium build. She dresses in traditional clothing  (hat, shawl and skirt), and her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish in the general culture and for business. She is the fifth in the line from the left. She is wearing a skirt with a cream colored sweater and a white and purple checked apron. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver, and with her children who go to school. They live in their own house built of Adobe with a metal sheeting roof it has water from an electric well and plumbing. The need to help with her family's household expenses led to her seeking a second work activity and to form a bank of people with businesses such as selling personal hygiene products, selling vegetables, selling bookstore items, selling food, selling breakfasts, selling second hand clothing, and public transportation such as a motorcycle taxi, so that they could ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling flax seed juice. Flax is a seed from the flax plant. her preparation method is putting the ground flaxseed in a container, adding 1 ½ cups of boiling water, and stirring it with a spoon. She adds lemon juice and lets it sit to add the sugar. Later she fills her thermos and sells it. She sells as a street vendor to merchants and vendors with sales stalls, who are her regular customers. “I started my business out of the need to work. i know the market and its needs,” she remarks. The advantage of the business is that she has regular customers. The disadvantage is the weather changes because she has to get around to find customers. Her dream is to open another business selling food to work in the evenings. She wants to buy a little cart to sell fried chicken. This is her 4th loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this activity.  

These are the reasons that Herminia is asking for a loan to buy a little cart to sell fried chicken in the evenings and have 2 activities.

loans.use: to buy a little cart to sell fried chicken at night and have 2 activities.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es soltera y tiene 55 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Rosa. She is single and is 55 years old. She has 2 children. She works in the business of selling beauty products. She sells lip pencils, creams and perfumes. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has already worked in this business for many years. Her dream is is to have a shop where she would be able to sell beauty products. The member is applying for a loan to buy creams, lip pencils and perfumes. 

The other members make a living selling beverages, working in carpentry, running a convenience store and operating a restaurant.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream and promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in the established period of time.

loans.use: to buy creams, lip pencils, and perfumes

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Sebastiana  pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue dedicándose  a la  producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez continua en la venta de comida para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sebastiana belongs to the communal bank SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL and continues working in the production and sale of dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt. Sebastania is a responsible and persevering woman, and continues selling food to all of her customers that request from her. Sebastiana wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family. 

Sebastiana requests the loan to buy milk. Sebastiana is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop her business and she promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is 33 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children.

She has a cereal selling business which has been operating for the last 5 years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to purchase more cereals such as maize and wheat to sell and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's education and to expand her business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and wheat for sale and make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 24 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a bicycle transport business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase another bicycle so he can serve more customers and increase his overall income. He hopes this will help him educate his child and provide for his family's needs.

His hopes and dreams for the future are buying motorcycles and being successful.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle so he can serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a 40-year-old, hardworking, honest, married man. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has eight children, five of whom attend school.

Selly owns a general store with retail prices in order to meet the daily needs of his family. Selly also practices farming, growing crops (e.g. maize, beans, and rice) to earn additional income. However, he is faced with price fluctuations and weather changes. Selly's desire is to educate his children and to own a wholesale shop.

With the loan, he intends to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour, maize flour, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Rose operates a retail shop with general merchandise to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and has managed to use her profits to build rentals, thus earning additional income.

Rose has a dream of expanding her business into wholesale. However, she is faced with price fluctuation and the challenge of limited capital to sustain customer demands. Rose intends to use the loan to buy soda, cassava flour, beer, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, cassava flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Satyaperkas

texts.en: Satyaperkas thanks all Kiva lenders once again for their helpful nature.  He has fully repaid his loan on time.  With the profits, he could save some money for the purchase of land. But that is not enough to purchase a rice plot.  So he will continue rice production.  For this purpose, he needs an additional 10,000 SRD to purchase farming inputs, including fertilizers, pesticides, and diesel oil.

loans.use: to purchase diesel oil, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Dagalas

texts.en: Dagalas is a 43-year-old hard working man, married with 5 children who lives in Kasese Uganda. Dagalas sells produce, that is to say dry beans, maize, peas, millet and others, in order to earn a living. Dagalas has been in that business for eight years. He also owns a depot selling beers, sodas and liquor to get additional income. He dreams of expanding his business despite being faced by the challenge of market competition and weather changes. Dagalas intends to use the loan to buy dry ground nuts, maize, coffee and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy dry ground nuts, maize, coffee and beans for selling.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en: Fulgence is married with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. He operates a retail shop in the Rwerere trading centre. He has done this business for a period of 8 years. Fulgence has been affected by a lack of capital to expand his business. So Fulgence joined Ugafode microfinance to access financial assistance to expand his business and serve the available market. Fulgence applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to add stock to his business, i.e. posho, rice, salt, rice, Vaseline and soda. Fulgence thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain and expand his business and encourages Ugafode to continue supporting low-income earners.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is 50 years old and is from Minia. She is married with 5 sons. Her husband is employed part-time. She decided to help her husband with the family income. Three months ago, she started selling liquid soap for dishes in her house. Her sales started to increase and she wants to buy more soap to meet the demands of her customers. So she is requesting a 1000 EGP loan to buy more liquid soap and other cleansers.

loans.use: to buy more liquid soap and other cleansers.

loans.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda is 55 years old from Minia. She is married with twelve children. Her husband fattens cattle and they have a bakery that Reda runs to help her husband with the family income but the baking oven needs maintenance. So she has requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a new oven tunnel to make better quality bread to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a new oven tunnel to make better quality bread to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him add more stock to his business and meet the demands of his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase doors or gates for her building under construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell and some condiments for making and selling breakfasts

loans.name: God

texts.en:
God is a repeat client who is married with five children, three of whom attending school. God does cattle fattening as his major source of income. He has done this business for a period of 15 years. He has been taking loans from Ugafode to expand his business and to pay for his children's fees.

God is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more cows for fattening. God thanks Ugafode and Kiva for the financial boost, which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 21-year-old woman from Minia. She is married and has one son. Her husband works part-time in a bakery.

Two years ago, she started selling vegetables in front of her house to help her husband with the family income. However, she is unable to afford more vegetables, which would increase her sales and make more money to cover her family's monthly expenses.

So, she requested a 1,000 EGP loan to buy more vegetables, such as potatoes, onions and zucchini.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as potatoes, onions and zucchini.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Isamar

texts.en:
Isamar is not married but lives with her boyfriend. They have a one-year-old daughter. Isamar's boyfriend works at Coroico and only comes home twice a month. Isamar is living with her parents.

Isamar has a farm where she sells pigs. She needs a loan to purchase a female pig so that she may have more animals to sell. She also needs money to purchase food for her other pigs.

In the future, Isamar would like to have her own land and house. She hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy a pig.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia  Albertina pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería y a la producción y venta  de leche, la socia Albertina lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimentos para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Albertina belongs to the communal bank SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL. She alternates her daily activities, working with livestock and the production and sale of milk. Albertina has worked in this business for years, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. Albertina wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

Albertina requests the loan to buy a cow and feed for her animals. She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop her business and she promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Carlos Edmundo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 49 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, también se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como pollos, gallinas, patos, entre otros para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Carlos espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old and lives in the family home with his partner. Their community is known for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. It is located in the District of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, which lies in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Carlos raises and sells small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. He also provides his services as a farm laborer. Carlos has experience in this business and good references from his customers. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and other livestock so that he can increase the inventory of his business. As a result, Carlos hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to his customers so that he can generate more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and other livestock.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a single lady with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda. With her previous loan, she managed to buy cooking oil, bread and sugar to sell. She has a general merchandise shop and also does farming, which adds to her income.

She is faced with the challenge of limited capital, which hinders her business growth. Besides that, she has hopes of constructing a family home. She has asked for a loan to buy more merchadise of splashes, cooking oil, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise of splashes, cooking oil, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gracious

texts.en:
Gracious is a 35-year-old married client with two children, both of whom attend school. He operates a grocery store in a trading center, which he has done for two years. He also does motorcycle taxi (boda boda) as an additional source of income.

Gracious has been taking loans from Ugafode, which has enabled him to expand his business. He applied for a 2,000,000 UGX loan to add stock in his grocery business. This includes sugar, Irish potatoes, salt, and yellow bananas. These items will serve more customers and enable him to earn more income. Gracious thanks Ugafode for their financial support, which enabled him to expand his grocery business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 39-year-old-married woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters in the Kutaisi district. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps people to make a living.

Ana decided to open a food shop and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to obtain a loan of 4,500 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of food products and will open a small shop near her house. She will work in her newly opened shop and will do her best to increase the family income. Ana awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market and to generate income.

loans.name: Jaspa

texts.en:
Jaspa is a 37-year-old married client with three children who attend school. He is a repeat customer of the institution, operating a bar/hotel/lodging establishment in Kisiizi Nyarushanje. He has done this business for two years but his major challenge is limited capital to expand his business.

Jaspa applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more beer and spirits to sell in his business. With this loan, he hopes to serve more clients and earn more income. Jaspa thanks Ugafode for financial assistance, which has improved his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beer and repair his car.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a married woman from Minia who has one child. Her husband is a civil servant with a very low income that does not meet the family's monthly expenses. So, they prepared a room in their house to start an internet café.

She requested 3,000 EGP to purchase three computers and three tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy computers, tables, and chairs for an internet cafe.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la serigrafía en forma independiente. Comenta que anteriormente trabajaba para otra persona y con el año que pasaba y la experiencia que ganaba fue adquiriendo sus propias herramientas hasta llegar a independizarse y hoy día ya tiene su propia clientela formada.
Jorge pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un vehículo que podrá utilizar en su negocio de su serigrafía. Agradece pro esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is from the city of Itá. He manages an independent screen printing business. Jorge says that he previously worked for another person. With the experience he gained, Jorge acquired his own equipment last year and became independent. Today he has an established clientele of his own.

Jorge is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of a vehicle that he will use for his screen printing business. He appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can keep growing as before.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for his screen printing business.

loans.name: Nwabisa

texts.en:
Nwabisa comes from a part of Soweto called Freedom Park. She is 27 years old and has two children, ages four and six.

Nwabisa joined her best friend to start a glass bottle recycling business. They source for empty bottles from the community, clean the bottles, pack them, and deliver them to a recycling firm where the bottles are weighed and the girls are then paid accordingly.

Nwabisa wants to expand the business by moving into other neighborhoods around Soweto. She is asking for a loan to buy large containers that can hold larger quantities of glass bottles. The containers will have wheels installed on the base to allow Nwabisa and her colleagues to easily navigate. Part of the loan will also help secure transportation, as the business wants to hire a pick-up truck for delivering to the recycling plant.

Being a young single mother, Nwabisa is determined to work hard and to create a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy large containers and pay for installation of wheels on the containers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La Señora Cecilia de 63 años de edad vive en el domicilio de sus padres junto a  su hermana, su actividad es la producción de miel de abejas y también la crianza de ganado vacuno de los  cuales genera sus ingresos, no  tiene  dependientes ya que es soltera presenta nivel de instrucción  Bachiller. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para apicultura con el fin de poder ampliar su negocio para que así produzca mayores cantidades y logre sacar sus derivados como ser propoleo y otros que le permitirán satisfacer todas las demandas de su clientes y aumentar su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Cecilia is 63 years old and lives at her parents’ home along with her sister. Her business involves honey production, but she also raises cattle in order to generate income. Cecilia has no dependents. She is single and has a high school education.

Cecilia is currently requesting a loan in order to buy beekeeping supplies so that she can expand her business. As a result, she will be able to produce in larger quantities and obtain derivative products, such as propolis and other substances, in order to satisfy all of the demands of her customers and increase her income level.

loans.use: to buy beekeeping supplies.

loans.name: Saul Orlando

texts.es:
Saúl, es una persona soltera, nadie depende económicamente de él, su negocio es trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, para el consumo personal y para comercializar, aprendió el oficio dentro de su familia, labora de 4:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m.
Se decidió por un crédito para comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas, dará un mejor trato a sus cultivos, espera que la cosecha sea productiva y tener nuevos ingresos con los que respaldara el pago de su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar su negocio y tener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Saúl is a single individual who has no financial dependents. His business involves working in the fields in order to produce basic staple crops for personal consumption and for sale. Saúl learned the trade from his family. He works from 4:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M.

Saúl decided to request a loan in order to buy compost, seeds, and insecticides so that he can provide better care for his crops. He hopes that his harvest will be productive so that he can have newly generated income to set aside toward the repayment of his debt.

His aspirations include improving his business and acquiring new customers.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
Rumilda es una joven que esta luchando para poder salir adelante por medio de sus estudios y también para poder ayudar a las personas por medio de su carrera de odontóloga. Comenta que su anterior préstamo de kiva lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder costear sus estudios.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas de la carrera, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rumilda is a young woman who is striving to get ahead in her studies. She also wants to help people using her degree in Dentistry. Rumilda says that her previous Kiva loan was used to pay her degree fees. As a result, she was able to cover the cost of her studies.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her degree fees once again. This will allow her to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Kiva lenders! Meet Esther, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 56 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Ndalu, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Esther has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Esther is contented with the farming way of life. 

Esther is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Esther feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Esther is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Esther so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock and to sell more soft drinks.

loans.name: Marina Marcia

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una mujer con mucha trayectoria, siempre ha sabido enfrentar las adversidades y salir con una sonrisa de ellas. Tan solo a sus 18 años tuvo que hacerse responsable de su primer hijo y eso le dio la fuerza necesaria para salir adelante. En su vida ha tenido muchos oficios, pero ahora los oficios que la mantienen son su pequeña pulpería y su taller de costura.  
Por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, productos de higiene personal, telas, hilos, etc. Que le servirán para ofrecer más variedad y cumplir con unos encargos de costura. Además, Doña Marina planea mejorar el techo de su casa para estar preparada para el próximo invierno.
texts.en:
Doña Marina is a woman with a deep history. She has always known how to face adversities and get through them with a smile. At only 18 years of age, she had to take responsibility for her first child. This gave the necessary strength to push forward. Marina has held many jobs in her life, but now she manages a small grocery store and a sewing workshop.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, beans, oil, snack foods, toiletry products, fabrics, thread, and other products. This will enable her to offer more variety and to complete a few sewing orders. In addition, Doña Marina plans to repair the roof of her house so that she will be prepared for next winter.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, snack foods, toiletry products, fabrics, thread, and other products.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala who is 55 years old, lives in Kobuleti district. She has a six-member family and she is the only breadwinner. With her secondary education, Makvala was unable to start any stable job, so she started a private activity. Specifically, she trades fruits and vegetables locally. She has her own customers, but she is unable to generate significant income for her large family's welfare. Makvala has a great desire to expand her trading and purchase a mini-bus. After several unsuccessful attempts, she applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the requested amount, Makvala will purchase a mini-bus and with the help of her husband, will trade the products in the nearby districts. They will sell fruits and vegetables door-to-door and will generate enough income to overcome their financial difficulties.
 
The loan will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling them to have better living conditions and expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus and trade in the other regions

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania, 25 years old, is from Minia. She is married with one son and her husband is a part-time farmer. They have a small grocery store project. They wish they could expand their project by increasing their sales. Rania requested a 4,000 EGP loan to buy more products to increase her sales and improve her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, sugar, sweets and biscuits

loans.name: Josephine Tebiita

texts.en:
Josephine is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd mdi, having taken previously a loan of UGX 1,000,000.  She is a married woman, 30 years old with children.

She is a businesswoman selling food at a road side restaurant in a bid to raise the family income. She is limited by capital to expand the business and so has applied for a loan of UGX 1,400,000 to increase her working capital in order to serve more customers. She is, however, faced with the challenges of competition and lack of enough space to seat her customers.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business and feed more clients.

loans.use: to add working capital to her food production business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a repeat client of the institution and married with three children, two of them attending school. Julius has been taking loans from Ugafode. Julius operates a retail shop as his major source of income and he also does boda-boda as an additional source of income. He applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to add stock to his business i.e. buying corn flour, sugar, books, and pens to make more profits. Julius thanks Ugafode for assistance, which has enabled him to buy his own motorcycle and sustain his business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in the shop

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divinas y Encantadoras está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, está integrado por 21 mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Silvia , es artesana, fabrica nichos (casitas artesanales para imágenes de Santos), gracias a esa actividad mantiene a su familia y cada día va mejorando su calidad de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus nichos, como ser arcillas, pinturas, apliques y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus trabajos.
texts.en:
The group named “Divinas Y Encantadoras” is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. There are 21 members, all of whom are giving their best effort so that they can provide their families with everything that they weren’t able to have.

Sra. Silvia is an artisan who makes “nichos” (small handcrafted decorative pieces that house images of patron saints). Thanks to this business, she is able to sustain her family and improve their quality of life each day. Silvia is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making “nichos” such as clay, paint, appliques, and other items so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, appliques, and other supplies.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a repeat client who has borrowed from UGAFODE for 10 years now. Her previous loan was for UGX 3,000,000.  She is a married woman, 39 years old, with children. All along, she has been paying her loan very well.

She is a businesswoman selling pumped water to the residents and owning rentals in a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy a water tank to save water, especially during the dry spell when there is a crisis. However, she is faced with the challenges of competition and limited capital.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business. She appreciates UGAFODE for the good partnership she has enjoyed throughout the years.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 39 years old from Minia. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a part-time farmer and she runs a small clothing and accessories shop. Sometimes she sells clothes on installments to her clients with a little increase in prices. 

She dreams of expanding her business, so she has requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more women's and kids' clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old. She is divorced but she has her own house. Rosa is mother of two adults and one young adult who is going to college. 

Rosa is a craftswoman. She makes magnets for freezers, as you can see in the picture. Rosa needs a loan to buy materials to make more magnets.

Rosa would like to have her own store in the future. Right now she goes to fairs to sell her products but that is very hard for her. She hopes you can help her because she doesn't get any help from her family as they have their own expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more magnets.

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Chaullay Centro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AZUCENAS DE CHAULLAY CENTRO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Primitiva ella es conviviente y tiene 58 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Las Azucenas de Chaullay Centro”. The bank is located in the District of Maranura in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Primitiva. She is 58 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has seven children. Primitiva works at her business of raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens until they reach the right size and weight. Afterwards, she sells them at different fairs. Through this small business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens. Primitiva is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

The other members sell agricultural crops, clothing, groceries, and food.

Primitiva is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and increase her genge business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is 35 years old, married and owns a small grocery store in the center of a small town called Villa del Carbon. He says that he rents the location and works with the support of his wife. In his store he sells dairy products, snacks, fruits and vegetables. He likes to offer a big variety and this helps to increase his sales. His biggest achievements are growing his business and having a great relationship with his wife.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery and convenience store.

loans.name: Bwebajja Development Group

texts.en:
Irene is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd mdi, having been inspired by an old client. She is a married woman, 30 years old, with children.
She is a businesswoman owning a shop. To increase her working capital/expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000. However, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business and generate income to educate her children. The group appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Julian Harriet

texts.en:
Julian is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd mdi, having taken previously a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a married woman, 32 years old, with children. She is a businesswoman selling traditional medicine. In a bid to increase her working capital/expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000, however she is faced with the challenges of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy packaging materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron for doors and to improve the roof of her house

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza es de la ciudad de San Pedro, ella esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y con ello quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar una notebook, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder cubrir su matricula y con ello poder estudiar y ser alguien en la vida. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Liza is from the city of San Pedro and is studying for a degree in Accounting. With her degree, she wants to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She says that her previous loan was used to buy a notebook computer, which was a very helpful.

Today she is requesting a loan in order to cover her enrollment so that she can study and make something out of her life. Liza is grateful for this opportunity she has received so that she can reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Hafsa, who is in her late 20s, is single with three children; two of them are still in school, and the other one is still small. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hafsa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Hafsa will share this loan with her loan group, "Mchicha," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 48 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maura Moserrat

texts.en:
Maura Monserrat is 27 years old. She is married and has two small children. She works as an administrative assistant in a company that makes marketing studies. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for the school inscription and books of her children. She is asking for a loan because she wants to give the best possible education to her children and is willing to make sacrifices to do it.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and books for her children.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is asking for an additional loan to restock her grocery store. She has been paying her first loan on time and comments that she needs to buy additional products to increase her sales. Amelia commented that she even hired one person to help her with sales during the weekends.

loans.use: to stock up her convenience store with commercial products.

loans.name: Katherine Isabel

texts.es:
Katherine Isabel es una joven estudiante de Arquitectura, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:                                                                                
 Mi   nombre es Katherine Isabel, tengo 19 años de edad, vivo con mi madre y mi hermana mayor, somos 4 hermanos, pero mis padres son divorciados, pero solo dos de  los 4 vivimos con ella. Por lo que solo cuento con el apoyo de mi madre, y la carrera que deseo estudiar  es muy costosa.
 Mi sueño es estudiar arquitectura, ya que me apasiona el arte, y me gusta por vocación, además  me gusta innovar, crear, diseñar, etc. Necesito  su apoyo de este préstamo porque sin el no podre cumplir mi objetivo o mi sueño, y a la vez llegar a la meta.
Dentro de mis planes, es sacarle el mejor provecho a mis estudios, para luego ponerlo en práctica, y de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida, tanto de mi familia como a los más necesitado.
En todo tipo de carrera hay desafío, competencias,  hay que luchar para cumplir con el objetivo, y alcanzar una meta, y pienso que con dedicación, disciplina y esfuerzo puedo lograrlo.
Cuento con su apoyo, porque sin esta no podré realizar mi sueño.
texts.en:
Katherine Isabel is a young woman who is studying Architecture. She is requesting a loan in order to cover her educational expenses. This is her story:

“My name is Katherine Isabel. I am 19 years old and I live with my mother and my older sister. There are four siblings, but when my parents divorced, only two of us went to live with our mother. I only receive support from my mother and the degree that I want to pursue is very expensive.

My dream is to study Architecture because I’m passionate about this art and would like to make it my vocation. I also like to innovate, create, design, etc. I need the support of this loan because without it, I will not be able to reach my goal and dream that I want to accomplish.

My plans include making the most of my studies so that I can put my education into practice. This will improve the quality of life for myself and my family, which is our greatest need. In every type of career, there will be challenges and skills that must be learned in order to meet an objective and reach a goal. I believe that I can accomplish this through dedication, discipline, and effort.

I need your support, because without it, I won’t be able to achieve my dream.”

loans.use: to pay her higher education expenses.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: La Señora Rosaura tiene 45 años de edad, vive en una vivienda de propiedad de sus suegros , junto a su conyugue y cuñadas tiene 3 hijos que depende de ella, la señora Rosaura realiza su actividad a diario, se dedica a la venta de sus productos de corte y confección lo que le sirve para mantener a su familia, su diario vivir es muy sacrificado ya que también tiene que hacer todos los quehaceres de su casa, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar máquinas de costura más modernas que le facilitan su trabajo y así pueda mejorar sus productos para satisfacer las demandas del mercado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosaura is 45 years old and lives in a house that is owned by her in-laws. She lives there with her husband and his sisters. Rosaura has three children who are dependent on her. She works every day by sewing and selling the products that she produces so that she can support her family. Her daily work requires a great deal of sacrifice because she must also take care of all of the household chores.

Today she is requesting a loan in order to buy more modern sewing machines that will facilitate her work. This will help her to improve her products so that she can satisfy the demands of the market and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines to improve her business.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Elmie has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Felna has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José, con la facilidad que le dio el crédito anterior para surtir la tienda ha generado mejores ganancias las cuales ha invertido en pagar deudas y cambiar su estilo de vida por uno más digno.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar jugos, dulces, gaseosas, pan, galletas, aceite, etc., así seguirá trabajando y generando los ingresos necesarios para sudsistir.
texts.en:
With the previous loan that was issued, José was able to stock his store and generate better earnings. This enabled him to repay his debts and achieve a more decent lifestyle.

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy juices, sweets, sodas, bread, cookies, oil, and other products so that he can continue working and generating the income he needs to survive.

loans.use: to buy juices, sweets, sodas, bread, cookies, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla proviene de una familia dedicada a la agricultura, ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agroindustrial, comenta que su meta futura es ser una buena profesional y con su trabajo ayudar a su familia.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Perla comes from a family that is devoted to agriculture. She is studying for a degree in Agroindustrial Engineering. Perla says that her goal for the future is to become a successful professional. She wants to help her family through her work.

Perla is doing her best to succeed so that she can make something out of her life. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees, which will allow her to continue her work.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children, all of whom are still in school.  She has been running two business, a mamalishe in the morning and she sells chips in the evening.  She works from 05am to 11pm daily and is able to make a a good monthly profit.  

This will be Amina's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and started selling chips.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, loan repayments, and household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock her mamalishe and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal, for cooking the food. She dreams of building her own house.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Kondoa", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe stockand to buy Irish potatoes cooking oil and charchaol for cooking the food.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Chuanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Chuanie works hard to support her family.

She has an entertainment karaoke business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Chuanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her karaoke machine for her entertainment karaoke business.

Chuanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her karaoke machine.

loans.name: Ricki Nelson

texts.es:
Continuar con el negocio familiar es el sueño de Ricki, por ello decidió estudiar administración de empresas, ya que esta carrera le ayudará a aplicar las herramientas necesarias para potenciar la micro empresa de su familia. Donde se dedican a la elaboración y venta de raspados.  
Ricki solicita el crédito para cubrir los gastos de su titulación universitaria, esto le será beneficioso porque podrá dedicarse por completo a la administración del negocio. Además, planea –una vez egresado- reinaugurarla con un estilo más formal, con lo cual aumentaran los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ricki’s dream is to continue the family business. For this reason, he decided to study Business Administration. With this degree, he will be able utilize the necessary tools in order to improve his family’s small business of making and selling snow cones.

Ricki is requesting a loan in order to cover the expenses related to his university degree. This will be beneficial because he can dedicate himself full-time to the study of Business Administration. In addition, once he graduates, he plans to restart the business in a more formal way so that it will increase its profits.

loans.use: to pay the expenses related to his university degree.

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У нее высшее образование, работает директором школы. Паризат в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 2000 году начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Паризат на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На участке 1,18 Га она выращивает сафлор и клевер. Видя дополнительный источник дохода в сельском хозяйстве, Паризат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и полеводство. Доходы от кредита Паризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что позволит увеличить доходы ее семьи.
texts.en: Parizat is 37 years old, married and a mother of 4 school-age and preschool-age children. She has a college education and works as a school principal. In search of a source of income for her family, Parizat started her own business in farming and animal husbandry in 2000. Thanks to Parizat's hard work, her farm currently contains 2 cows, 10 sheep and 2 horses. She grows clover and safflower on 1.18 hectares of land. Seeing additional income in agriculture, Parizat requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a bull and to cultivate her land. Parizat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business, which will allow her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a bull and to cultivate her land

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 23 Señoras que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida. Son todas jefas de familia que luchan para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Purificación, madre de un hijo, que está estudiando gracias al esfuerzo de la Sra. Purificacion, y otra ya mayor. Ella es vendedora de todo tipo de productos como ropas, zapatos, venta de ruedas recicladas de automóviles, etc., cabe resaltar que es muy activa en su comité, es una excelente y además es la tesorera de este grupo. Poco a poco ella está capacitándose para poder mejorar cada día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas, zapatos y otros para poder vender y seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 23 women who are looking to achieve a better quality of life. All of them are the leaders of their families, so they strive to help their loved ones by providing them a decent life without deprivation.

One of the members is Sra. Purificación. She is the mother of a child who is in school thanks to her efforts. Purificación also has a child that is now grown. She sells all types of products such as clothes, shoes, recycled automobile tires, and other items. It should be noted that she is very active in her committee and is doing an excellent job as the treasurer of her group. Through the training she has received, Purificación is improving a little bit each day.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes, shoes, and other products that she can sell. As a result, she can continue her work just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other products that she can sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Susana, la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue  dedicándose a  la Ganadería, principalmente  la venta de leche de vaca, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo leche a todos sus clientes que solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Sra. Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She continues to manage her livestock business, primarily the sale of dairy cows. Susana appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms. She is a responsible and diligent individual. Susana continues to sell milk to all of her customers who request it. Working in this manner enables her to help her family get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 26 years old and married with one child in school. Ivy works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, etc.

Ivy has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Ivy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: Kafedore

texts.en:
Since Carline was a kid, she dreamed of starting an artisan shop within the community where she lived. For years, she has used her productive imagination to make beautiful artworks such as clothing, jewelries and handbags with worthless materials like wood, animal bones and coconut shells. 

Carline wants to increase her equipment to offer a variety of fashion jewels and clothing. This is why she has come to Zafen to request a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a drill press stand, raw materials and an electric sewing machines

loans.name: Icfotep

texts.en:
The earthquake of January 2010 destroyed many technical schools in the country. A lot of students were not able to pursue further education. Ricardo, who was also affected by this horrible situation, decided to bring his support to the education sector in Gressier. By opening ICFOTEP, he understood that investing in education was an effective way to create opportunities for youth, especially those living outside of Port-au-Prince. 

ICFOTEP has four years of existence providing training to hundreds of Haitian students in nursing and cosmetology. To do that, Ricardo thrives to successfully hire qualified teachers, and offers affordable services to everyone. 

Now, Ricardo is challenged to bring more innovation by acquiring a generator, chairs, a medical bed and some office supplies. A loan from Zafen will help the business offer a better quality of services to the nursing students.

loans.use: to purchase a generator, metallic chairs, hospital beds and some office supplies

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Folklore de Mexico was established in September of 2014 by Ms. Socorro A. when she witnessed the lack of genuine and quality specialty folkloric stores in the San Gabriel Valley and surrounding areas. Her store specializes in folkloric dancing apparel and accessories, but she carries attire and accessories for all other major Mexican holidays. 

Ms. Socorro began dancing folklorico at the age of 5 and has not stopped performing since then. Although folkloric dancing is less popular here than in her native Mexico, her passion for this dance transcends all borders. Her passion for this dance, the joy she experienced every time she performed and her desire to expose others to his beautiful tradition is what ultimately inspired her to open her own shop. Her products bring a cultural awareness to entire communities and to generations that were previously unattached or simply unaware of the beauty of folkloric dancing and other traditions; this is why she ultimately loves her job and what she does. 

As a veteran folkloric dancer herself, she knew how difficult it was to not only find specific products she needed for the traditional Mexican dance, but also for those products to be of high quality. When she first began, her biggest challenge was finding these high-quality products at good prices, but as a connoisseur, she quickly identified which vendors would meet her high standards. Her biggest challenge now is finding the capital to purchase inventory to meet her growing demands. With Kiva funding, Ms. Soccoro will be able to obtain the inventory she needs to secure contracts with schools, recreational parks, and other organizations that will help her not only continue to fuel her passion, but also allow her business to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory for her folkloric store

loans.name: Ofaso

texts.en:
OFASO is a rural organization that has been fighting specifically for women's autonomy since 2005. Nadège is leading this organization in its experience in food processing, particulaly in plantain slicing and plantain powder. From this loan requested, Nadège hopes to modernize the processing plant by purchasing a plantain chip slicer, two boilers and an industrial machine for fries.

The committee members can be identified in the picture as Nadège as CEO; Mathania as accountant; Rose as marketing manager; Marie Annite as staff secretary; Dina as production supervisor; and Christelle as stock manager.

loans.use: to purchase boilers, a plantain chip slicer and industrial machine for fries

loans.name: Corina Michelle

texts.es:
Corina Michelle es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es  Corina Michelle, estoy matriculada en la Universidad católica del Cibao UCATECI, cursando la carrera de Medicina, en la actualidad estoy realizando el 7 cuatrimestre, estoy soltera y convivo con mi hermano de 19 años, el cual también estudia.
En la actualidad mi padre está desempleado y madre trabaja en el laboratorio clínico del Hospital de esta ciudad, con ingresos mínimo que no cubrimos los gastos del presupuesto familiar, de no lograr este préstamo me veré en   necesidad con mucho dolor de dejar de estudiar, algo que no quiero ya que Siempre me ha interesado saber y conocer la importancia de la salud y enfermedades, porque me apasiona.
Al finalizar mi carrera seré médica Internista o cardióloga. Mi finalidad es superarme como persona y servir de apoyo a mi familia.
texts.en:
Corina Michelle is a young woman who is studying Medicine. She is requesting a loan in order to cover her educational expenses. This is her story:

“My name is Corina Michelle. I am enrolled at Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), where I’m studying for a degree in Medicine. I am currently in my seventh semester. I am single and live with my 19-year-old brother who is also studying.

My father is currently unemployed and my mother works at a clinical laboratory for a hospital in the city. With minimal income, we are not able to cover the expenses of the family budget. By not obtaining this loan, it will be painful for me to quit my studies, which is something that I don’t want to happen. I have always been interested in learning and knowing about the importance of health and sickness. I am passionate about this subject.

Upon finishing my degree, I want to work in internal medicine or cardiology. My goal is to succeed as a person and to help my family.”

loans.use: to pay her higher education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely is 28 years old and married. She works very hard to earn a living.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Lovely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and has two children who are in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Argie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from seaweed culture. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Argie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан 62 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1990 году Алмакан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Алмакан, ее хозяйство на сегодня насчитывает корову и 9 овец. Дополнительно она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и обучение внуков.
texts.en: Almakan is 62 years old, married and raised 3 children. In search of a source of income for her family, Almakan started her own business in animal husbandry and farming in 1990 with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Almakan's hard and persistent work, today her farm contains a cow and 9 sheep. Additionally, she grows rice. Her monthly income amounts up to 25,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Almakan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Almakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into growing her business and education for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 53 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is in school.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns income from farming sugarcane and rice retailing.

Anita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Seyilkan

texts.ru: Сейилкан, 61 год, вдова, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Как и многие семьи в сельской местности, Сейилкан откармливают скот и занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году. На сегодняшний день, Сейилкан в своем хозяйстве имеет 4 коровы, 30 овец. На 1,20 Га она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому а целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сейилкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 телят и 10 овец.  Доходы Сейилкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и улучшение благосостояния ее семьи.
texts.en: Seyilkan is 61 years old, a widow and has grown and independent children. Just like many other families in rural areas, Seyilkan has been involved in fattening up livestock and in farming since 2000. Today, Seyilkan's farm contains 4 cows, 30 sheep and 1.20 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes. Her monthly profit amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life. This is why, to continue expanding her business, Seyilkan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 3 calves and 10 sheep. Seyilkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and improving her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves and 10 sheep in order to increase her income

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jonabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 63 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Leah is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

She has been farming sugarcane for ten years now, and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell sea cucumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumber to sell for her business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumber to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has always dreamed of operating and managing his own business to support his family. 

He used his loan to buy raw materials and ingredients to make fish sauce and vinegar for his business. 

He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients to make fish sauce and vinegar for his business

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада, 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айзады- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айзады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова, 10 овец. На 4,0 ГА выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aizada is 35 years old.  She and her husband are raising three children.  Aizada has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 16 years ago when she first bought livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one cow and ten sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans on four hectares of land.  Aizada makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a heifer and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy one heifer to invest in her business.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина, 39 лет, замужем, дети взрослые. У Тахмины- высшее образование, она работает учителем и занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав много лет назад. Тахмина очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются: 15 овец и 2 коровы. Также Тахмина обрабатывает 1,60 ГА земли, где выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тахмина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земли.
texts.en: Tahmina is 39 years old and married.  Her children are adults already.  Tahmina has a college degree and works as a teacher.  In addition, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started in this field many years ago.  Tahmina is very responsible, sociable, and she has a positive attitude toward life.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has 15 sheep and two cows on her farm.  She also grows beans for resale on 1.6 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 16,500 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.  She also intends to save enough money to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 37-year-old, married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a general store business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, household products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, household products, and other groceries

loans.name: Chuitukan

texts.ru: Чуйтукан 60 лет, замужем, есть 2 дочери и 2 сына. У нее высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1992 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 11,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Чуйтукан есть 3 коровы, 2 теленка и 5 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Вся экологически чистая продукция Чуйтукан пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. Доходы от кредита Чуйтукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Chuitukan is 60 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters and two sons.  She has a college education.  As her family's main source of income, she has been involved in agriculture since 1992, the year she started her own business with an initial capital of 11,000 som (KGS).  She currently has three cows, two calves and five sheep on her farm.  She also grows corn and clover on one hectare of land.  Her organic agricultural products are in high demand and bring her a good profit.  Eager to further grow her business, Chuitukan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a few heifers.  Chuitukan is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a few heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Saadatkan

texts.ru: Саадаткан, 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Она занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1998 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Саадаткан на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров и 13 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 14,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и увеличения получаемой прибыли, Саадаткан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка овец для разведения. Доходы от кредита Саадаткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Saadatkan is 59 years old and the mother of three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry, having started her own business in 1998.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has five cows and 13 sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 14,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent living nor to provide for her family.

Eager to further grow her business and to increase her earnings, Saadatkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) in order to buy and raise sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.
