loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as coffee, oil, milk and noodles

loans.name: Aibek

texts.ru: Айбек, 45 лет, в разводе, 2 детей. У него среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в15 лет назад с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Айбека, на сегодняшний день он имеет 1 корову, 10 овец. Также 2,89 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой выращивает клевер. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Aibek is 45 and divorced with two children. He has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for his family, a business he started 15 years ago with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to his hard work, he currently has one cow and 10 sheep as well as 2.89 hectares of his own land where he grows clover. He sells milk daily.

With the goal of further developing his business, Aibek has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow for fattening and resale. He plans to put profits from the loan into further developing his business, so that he can renovate his home.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening and resale

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза, 32 года, не замужем. Образование-среднее. На протяжении 14 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности, на сегодняшний день Феруза имеет хорошее хозяйство: 3 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Феруза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Feruza is 32 and single with a high school education. She has been working in animal husbandry for 14 years, a business she started with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work and responsibility, she currently has a good-size farm with three cows and 10 sheep. Her monthly income is 7,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Feruza has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Saadatkhan

texts.ru: Саадатхан, 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее - средне-специальное образование, на протяжении 20 лет работает мед сестрой. Она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством вместе с супругом,  с покупки скота на 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Саадатхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров и 10 овец, она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саадатхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Саадатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Saadatkhan is 44 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working as a nurse for 20 years. She started working in animal husbandry and agriculture together with her husband with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has six cows and 10 sheep and grows alfalfa. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Saadatkhan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase livestock to fatten and then resell at the market for a higher price. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and into her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Salkynai

texts.ru: Салкынай, 37 лет, замужем, есть 3 дочери и 2 сына. У нее среднее образование, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Салкынай на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. Также на земельном наделе мерою 0,33 Га, она выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Также она занимается продажей сушенных фруктов. Ежемесячный доход Салкынай около 200,0 долларов (USD). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 1,000 долларов (USD) на покупку сушенных фруктов для реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность устроить старшую дочь в университет.
texts.en:
Salkynai is 37 and married with three daughters and two sons. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows as well as 0.33 hectares of land where she grows corn for sale. She also sells dried fruit. Her monthly income is about $200 USD.

With the goal of further developing her business, Salkynai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase dried fruit for resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, so that she can pay her oldest daughter's way through university.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit for resale

loans.name: Sanabarkan

texts.ru: Санабаркан 54 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование,работает директором школы, получая заработную плату примерно 11,400 сом (KGS) в месяц. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Санабаркан занимается полеводством, также есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Санабаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку дома для сына.
texts.en:
Sanabarkan is 54 and a widow with three children. She has a higher education and works as a school director, receiving a salary of 11,400 KGS per month. She also works in farming as an additional source of income for her family and has two cows and 10 sheep.

With the goal of further developing her business, Sanabarkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer and seeds to cultivate the land. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer so she can cultivate the land and grow organic produce

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo owns and operates a farm to plant and harvest bananas to sell. He has been  in this business for seven years. He was able to expand his farm after taking his previous loan and has successfully repaid it with his generated income. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. He plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions and sustain his family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Israel Simon

texts.es:
Israel es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de administración de empresas.
Él es inteligente, feliz, alegre, comprometido con su trabajo y estudios, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en una escuela superior situado en la zona central un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 7-18 grados centígrados.
Israel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque sus estudios lo realiza en español y estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza junto a sus abuelos que ya no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario, agua potable y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de administración de empresas y se encuentra en segundo semestre del primer año, se prepara para ser un profesional emprendedor, con una visión estratégica y liderazgo, capacitado para crear, gestionar y desarrollar empresas, utilizando eficientemente recursos humanos, tecnológicos y financieros. “tengo el ideal de administrar varios negocios y hacerme responsable del trabajo de los demás…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja en una imprenta como diseñador gráfico y empastador. La ventaja de sus estudios es que son por las noches, la desventaja es que trabaja todo el día y termina la jornada agotado. Su sueño es terminar su carrea y abrir su propia empresa de impresiones,  el desea realizar la compra de una laptop y una impresora multifunción para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que trabaja y 1 año que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Israel solicita un préstamo para la compra una computadora portátil y una impresora multifunción para terminar sin inconvenientes el primer año de universidad.
texts.en:
Israel, age 27, is single and does not have children.  He is studying for a degree in Business Administration.  He is intelligent, happy, committed to his work and studies, responsible, and very hard-working.  He is studying at a school of higher education in the central zone.  The area is known for its commerce in all areas and for housing universities, public offices, and private companies that exist side by side.  It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 7 and 18 degrees centigrade.

Israel has a dark complexion; short, black hair; and brown eyes.  He is short and thin.  His mother tongue is Ayamará, which he does not speak now because his studies are in Spanish, and he is studying English as a second language.

He lives with his grandparents, who no longer work.  They live in their own house make from brick and cement with a metal sheeting roof.  They have electricity, gas for the home, running water, and indoor plumbing.

He is studying for a degree in Business Administration, and his is in the second semester of his first year.  He is preparing to be an enterprising professional with a strategic vision and leadership, who is trained to create, manage, and develop companies.  He will do this by efficiently using human, technological, and financial resources.  “I have the dream of administering various businesses and being responsible for others’ work,” he says.

In addition to his studies, he works at a printers as a graphic designer and bookbinder.  The advantage of his studies is that they are at night.  The disadvantage is that he works all day and is very tired at the end of his work day.

His dream is to complete his degree and open his own printing business.  He wishes to buy a laptop and a multifunction printer in order to continue with his studies.  This is his first loan cycle with this institution in his six years of working and his first year of studying.

For these reasons Israel is requesting a loan to buy a laptop and a multifunction printer in order to complete his first year at the university without any problems.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a multifunction printer in order to complete his first year at the university without any problems.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store and requests 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sardines, noodles, and coffee to sell.

She is  industrious and earns additional income through food vending. She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to further build her businesses.

Bella dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  sardines, noodles, and coffee.

loans.name: Torkunbubu

texts.ru: Торкунбубу, 46 лет, замужем, трое детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2012 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 9 коров и 8 овец, также есть земельный надел размером 3,0 ГА, где она выращивает люцерну. Торкунбубу известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек.  Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Torkunbubu is 46 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in farming since 2012 as an additional source of income. She currently has nine cows and eight sheep on her farm as well as 3 hectares of land where she grows alfalfa.

Torkunbubu is known as a principled, honest, fair and hopeful person. In order to develop her business, she has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, two attend school.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 15 years and is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.
She earns additional income buying  and selling dry goods.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is  to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hailyn

texts.en:
Hailyn is a 53-year-old married woman with six children.

Hailyn works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store. She requests  20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, juice, cooking oil, and spices.

Hailyn has borrowed and successfully repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 5 years and earns an income raising pigs.

Hailyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, juice, cooking oli, and spices.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 35-year-old married woman with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a plastic wares business for 5 years. She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional plastic wares to sell.

Carmelita has borrowed and successfully repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from vending and raising chickens.

Carmelita wishes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic wares to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy a lot of planks to resell so as to earn more.

loans.name: Ainash

texts.ru: Айнаш, 51 год, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Айнаш среднее образование, она в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 20 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,50 Га, где Айнаш выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнаш обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят с целью разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнаш планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Ainash is 51 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in farming as an additional source of income. She has three cows and 20 sheep on her farm as well as 1.5 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn for sale. Her total monthly income is up to 15,000 KGS.

In order to further develop her farm, Ainash has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase calves so that she can develop and increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm and also wants to save toward building a house.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Serason Indah Group

texts.en:
The Serason Indah group is one example of the successful groups in the welfare of its members. After passing five loan periods, three members managed to get the maximum results and they are able to set aside the profits to be used as working capital so that today they decided to quit the membership of the group and continue the business with their own capital. This is a good example for the women where they live and also provides an opportunity for other women to join the group to receive a loan and training on the raising of pigs. Because one of the resigning members was the head of the group, the group chose a new head and they chose Ni Wayan.

Ni Wayan is a woman who lives alone because she does not have a husband or children. She works hard to support herself. She’s using the loan to buy superior quality piglets and feed. She also has plans to build a small shop in front of her house. She hopes all her plans run smoothly.

loans.use: to buy superior quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Merlyna

texts.en: Merlyna is a businesswoman in Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old, married and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Merlyna runs a retail store selling wooden boards for carpentry. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for more inventory of round logs for board cutting to sell. Merlyna believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs.She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of round logs to cut boards to sell

loans.name: Zarele

texts.en:
Zarele is 42 years old and married with four children.  With four children in school, Zarele works very hard to provide for them.

Zarele runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Zarele has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria is 61 years old and has one child in school.

Maria has a abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase abaca fiber to use in her business.

Maria has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase abaca fiber to use in her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 48 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them. Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years now. 

Vivian requested an 8,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 33 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. В 2012 году, начала торговый бизнес, продает товары широко назначения, мыломоющие. Также занимается животноводством и полеводством, есть 11 коров и выращивает люцерну. Дети помогают по хозяйству. Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита позволят Динаре улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и дать высшее образование ее детям.
texts.en:
Dinara is 33 and married with two children. She started her own retail business in 2012, selling a wide range of cleaning products and other goods. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture - she has 11 cows and grows alfalfa. Her children help with the farm.

Dinara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase the amount of goods she has for sale. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her well-being, to develop her business and to give her children a higher education.

loans.use: to increase the amount of goods available in her shop

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na empresa  de Água como Engarrador a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e varões, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra, contrair matrimónio e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos.
texts.en: Manuel was born in Chibuto, in the Gaza Province.  He is 33 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  He is the father of 2 young children who attend school.  He does not support anyone else. He has worked a s a bottler for the water company for more than 8 years, where he earns a salary that he applies to household expenses.  With the loan he is requesting he plans to continue construction on his home by purchasing building materials such as sand, cement, metal panels, and bars.  This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to complete construction, formalize his marriage, and fund his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, metal panels, and bars.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilanculos Província de Inhambane tem 49 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 12 filhos dos quais 5 maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 netos e 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
É negociante de roupa usada no mercado informal a mais de 12 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o presente empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo fardos de roupa usada. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos e abrir uma machamba usando o sistema de regadio para sustentar a sua família
texts.en: Jose was born in Vilanculos, Inhambane Province.  He is 49 years old and lives with his wife.  He has 12 children, 5 of whom are adults.  All attend school.  He also supports 2 grandchildren and 2 nephews who live with him.   Jose is a merchant who has sold used clothing in the informal market for more than 12 years.  The money he earns is applied to household expenses.  He is requesting this loan to increase the volume of his business by purchasing bundles of used clothes.  This is his 8th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to start a business raising chickens and start a family farm plot with irrigation in order to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha, Província de Maputo tem 43 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus dois enteados.
É trabalhador da empresa  de Água a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Uma vez que ele é negociante solicita um empréstimo para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como: arroz, feijão, sabão e outros. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e expandir mais o seu negócio. O seu maior desafio é dar conforto a sua família.
texts.en: Jose was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo Province.  He is 43 years old and married.  He has 2 children who attend school and he also supports his two stepchildren.  He has worked for the water company for more than 2 years and the salary he earns is applied to household expenses.  Jose is also a merchant and is requesting a loan to meet his customers' needs by purchasing basic goods such as rice, beans, soap, etc.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he hopes to complete construction on his home and further expand his business.  His greatest challenge is to provide comfort to his family.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, soap, etc.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para poder sostener la economía de su hogar, apoyada en su tienda de productos básicos desde hace 6 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este beneficio. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos que son su mayor alegría y a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. María desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: sachet de champú, desodorantes, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, leche en polvo, etc. y de esta manera seguir mejorando la calidad de vida que ofrece a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is 43 years old. She is an enterprising woman who makes an effort every day to sustain the household economy which has been supported by her basic food item store for the past 6 years. She feels happy to be able to count on this benefit. She lives in her own house with her two children who are her greatest joy and whom she has been able to raise as a single mother. María  wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in packets of shampoo, deodorants, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk powder, etc. In this way she can continue to improve the quality of living that she provides her children.

loans.use: to invest in shampoo sachets, deodorants, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, powder milk, etc.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 48 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is into a direct-selling business, selling soap, shampoo, and other personal products. She wanted to improve her income to save funds for emergency purposes. She doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances: that is why she patiently engages herself in this simple business. 

Tita is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy fabric conditioner, laundry soap, and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She hopes to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fabric conditioner, laundry soap and cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of a new variety of rice for her farm for her rice farming business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years. Jocelyn earns more income from buying and selling coconut wine, running a general store and food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of a new variety of rice for her farm.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Sreyneang is 19 years old, a single daughter who lives with her parents and an older brother in the Svay Reang province in Cambodia. Currently, she is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in English literature in her first year at a university in the province. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a grocer. Sreyneang needs the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the second year; therefore she is requesting a loan. With the loan, she will earn an associate’s degree successfully. Sreyneang’s dreams are to have a proper job and to save money to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the second year

loans.name: Victoria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane, tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 4 filhos menores de idade apenas 2 é que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha na empresa de Serralharia e Estruturas Metálicas a um ano onde e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e outro. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e construir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade
texts.en: Victoria was born in Massinga, in Inhambane Province.  She is 32 years old and married.  She has 4 young children, 2 of whom attend school.  She also supports 2 nephews who live with her.  For the past year she has been employed at a metalworking and metal structures business and the money she earns is applied to household expenses and to building her home. With this loan she plans to continue construction on her home by purchasing building materials such as sand, cement, etc.  This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku. In the future she plans to complete construction and build a store to sell basic staple goods.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Bun Lestari Group

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan for Bun Lestari group and they have paid all the previous loans on time. With 10 members, they can keep the pigs well, and the pigs grow rapidly. No diseases have attacked the pigs, because Bun Lestari group is always giving the pigs vitamins and nutritious feeds.

Ni Wayan, as the head, succeeds in organizing the group and also selling her pigs. She earns 250.000 IDR per pig. She has four pigs. She’s really satisfied with the results. She says thank you to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. She saves the profit for future needs.

To continue and develop the business, the Bun Lestari group requests this loan. The loan will be used to buy local piglets and superior piglets. Ni Wayan already has a sow. The loan is used to buy feed and fix the cage for the pigs. Because the current cage can’t accommodate the pigs, the piglets go into her garden. She hopes that the cage will be fixed immediately so that the piglets do not roam and disturb neighbors. With this effort, Ni Wayan supports her husband to fulfill the needs of families.

loans.use: to buy feed and fix the cage for the pigs

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bilene Província de Gaza tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 3 filhos apenas 1 é menor de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa. 
É negociante a mais de 10 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade como: amendoim e feijão. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
 Futuramente pretende ampliar sua residência, erguer dependências para aluguer e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Teresa was born in Bilene, in Gaza Province.  She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children, only one of whom is a minor.  All of the children attend school.  She also supports her niece, who lives with her. She has been a merchant for more than 10 years and applies the money she earns to cover household expenses. She is requesting a loan to increase the volume of her business selling basic goods such as peanuts and beans.  This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future she plans to expand her home, build additional buildings that she can rent out, and pay for her children's education through high school.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, sweet bread, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en: Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. To make a living, Aracelle runs a retail store. Aracelle has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. Aracelle is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, sugar, milk and sachet products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, sugar, milk and sachet products

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 65 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living and help her husband to provide for her children's needs, she engages in and manages a transport business. She decided again to take a loan to buy motor parts for maintenance so that their motorcycle will be in good condition and cater to more passengers to generate more income.

Thelma wants to buy a new motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina has been earning  from her coconut farm for years. Her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy fertilizer was successfully repaid. She earns well from her farm. Recently, she took a new loan to finance the  labor costs for harvesting the coconut. Rizalina plans to cultivate the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future and provide her family a better living condition.

loans.use: to finance the labor cost for harvesting the coconut.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc. Leonisa industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig-fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonisa dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Armila

texts.en:
Armila is 33 years old, married with three children.

Armila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, personal care products, bread, coffee, cooking oil and other items. Armila has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from  raising pigs.

Armila aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, personal care products, bread, coffee, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Maria Yessenia

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 13 años que estudia séptimo grado y un hijo de 11 años  de edad, viven junto a la mamá por sus problemas de salud que padece. 

María, se dedica al servicio de sastrería desde que tiene 17 años, su papá le pagó una amiga de la familia, para que le enseñaran el oficio, para lograr aprender el oficio, ella tenía que viajar en bus aproximadamente 35 kilómetros desde su casa.

Ahora María, solicita el crédito para comprar una maquina semi-industrial de costura.

La máquina de coser le servirá para emplear a una persona, para ser más eficiente y cumplir con el contrato pactado con el ministerio de educación, que es de hacer 200 uniformes escolares.   

Su máximo sueño es, que sus hijos sean personas profesionales.
texts.en: María is a 40 year old single mother. She has a 13 year old daughter who is in Grade 7 and an 11 year old son. They live together with her mother because of her health problems. María has been working as a seamstress for 17 years. Her father paid a friend of the family to teach her this trade. She has to travel about 35 km from her house to work. María is currently requesting a loan to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine. The sewing machine will serve to hire a person in order to be more efficient in filling a contract for the Ministry of Education to make 200 school uniforms. Her greatest dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Otellia

texts.en:
To earn a living, Otellia is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan again to buy additional goods and items for the store to sell so that her inventory will increase and generate more income.

Otellia's plan for the future is to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items such as noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soap and condiments.  She is a 30-year-old married woman with two children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 6 and the youngest is 3. She has been running a variety store for eight years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock for the store. This will fill her store with various stock and attract more customers to her shop. In this way, her income will augment and able to handle her finances. She could be able to provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

Algin would like to expand her business to become more sustainable and successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the store

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used for the maintenance and safety of her schoolhouse for rent. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her rental business, where she is shown in her photo, she is working on opening a small canteen by her house.

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use as initial capital for a small canteen which she will soon operate. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, for it will greatly help in sending her children to school. 

Josie hopes for her new canteen business to be successful so she can prepare for her children's college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients such as fresh meat, fish, vegetables and condiments for her canteen.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional flour, sugar, margarine, and other ingredients for her bakery business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional flour, sugar, margarine, and other ingredients

loans.name: Lucenia

texts.en:
Lucenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Lucenia has been in this business for 15 years. Lucenia earns additional income from buying and selling fertilized duck eggs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Lucy has been in this business for three years. Lucy earns additional income from farming sugarcane and trucking transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and married with 7 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, etc. to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from ambulant vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sandals, shorts, etc. to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

Elisa has been in this business for 16 years. Elisa earns more income from direct selling avon and Tupperware products.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sandals, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 63 years old and married with seven children She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Pacita has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 49 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Marlyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Nesel

texts.en:
Nesel is 60 years old and single with four children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nesel has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tessie is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Tessie has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. Jovelyn is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and widowed with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Letecia has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 57 years old and married with five children.

She works, hard to provide for her family. Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, bread, chips, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Imelda aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Abraham Joaquin

texts.es: Abraham de 22 años de edad es un joven emprendedor que se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante apoyado en su negocio de venta de productos básicos, la cual realiza en su vivienda desde hace 4 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar de 5 personas desde hace 23 años. Abraham desea invertir en más mercadería para su negocio ya que desea atraer una mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, arroz, frijoles, leche en polvo, café, bebidas frías, etc.
texts.en: Abraham is 22 years old. He is a young entrepreneur every day to get ahead in his business selling basic food items. He has been doing this for 4 years at his house so he has a large quantity of clients who frequent him more each day. He lives in his own house with his family made up of 5 persons for the past 23 years. Abraham wants to invest in more merchandise for his business as he wants to attract a greater number of clients. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sweets, rice, beans, milk powder, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to invest in sweets, rice, beans, powdered milk, coffee, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 57 years old, married and have two children, To earn a living she farms bananas farming. It is a good business for the family because they earned P 5,000 a month. She decided to take a loan to pay labor costs to harvest her crop.

Gloria wants to save her profits.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost to harvest bananas.

loans.name: Florsisa

texts.en:
Florsisa is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She owns a tricycle business that her husband operates. This has been the source of their income for the past four years now. 

Florsisa is asking to take a loan to pay for the repair of the tricycle and to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, chains and fuel. A loan will help them maintain the good working condition of the tricycle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the tricycle and to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, chains and fuel

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has operated a small sari-sari or variety store business in her place for more than three years now. She also earns an additional income through food vending.  

Jackielyn is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and others. A loan will allow Jackielyn to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and ingredients like meat and vegetables

loans.name: Jissa

texts.en:
Jissa is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Jissa lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte. Jissa has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now. 

Jissa is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is thankful that she was granted an 18,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for the materials and maintenance for her tricycle business. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her tricycle, she was encouraged that she was able to invest in a van for rental service. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to pay for the tools and maintenance of her van. It is very important that her van is always in good running condition, to ensure continuous efficient service to her clients. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given to her, for it will greatly help in their daily sustenance.

Lilia hopes to serve her clients well and prays for the safety of her husband driver and their passengers. She dreams of raising their quality of living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tools and maintenance of her van for rent.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 36, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite in the Philippines. Married to Jerson, her business partner, they have one child who is not of school age. She manages her household while operating the business. Elizabeth augments their income to help meet their daily personal, household needs. 

Elizabeth operates a variety store and sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items. She buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece to make a profit. They also has a "Piso" net (computer shop), which her husband operates. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 120000 loan to buy grocery items such  as rice, can goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Elizabeth hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can prepare for her child's education. She prays for a quiet and happy married life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 
------------------------------------------------
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 60 years old and has four children. Catalina is married and has two children who are in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Catalina has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 52 years old and has one child. Eugenia is married and has one child in school.

Eugenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eugenia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eugenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for her farming sugarcane business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional chickens and feeds for her business.

Susana has been raising poultry for 12 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens and feeds for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 38 years old now.

Evelyn has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase items to sell like clothes, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like clothes, etc.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 32 years old and has three children. Lyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Lyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36 years old and has three children. Mary Jane is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming rice for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 49 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a coconut palm making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for two years.

In the future Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Norsuita

texts.en:
Norsuita is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norsuita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and feed.

Norsuita has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 45 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jena requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed.

Jena has been fattening pigs for 10 years and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jena would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Mera. Mera lives in South Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her children. Mera owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. Her community sees Mera as a friendly and informative mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Mera needs additional capital and is seeking a working-capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Mera’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, one of Ruma’s latest products, called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Mera is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Industrious, resourceful, curious, and talented are a few of the qualities of Annah, a 43-year-old woman. Annah started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kipsuter, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Today, she sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. 

She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. 

Although she earns profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She requests a loan, which she will use to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, she will have an easier time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax. It can also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. 

Annah believes that with this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 44 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Riffat’s son, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Riffat has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR, for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Riffat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Ela. She lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Ela lives with her husband and her two children. 

She sells mobile phone’s accessories and mobile airtime credits from her stall. 

Ela realizes that she can help her family by increasing her income; that's why she decided to join Ruma last year. Ela is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as cheerful and kind.

As her business grows, Ela needs additional capital. She will use this loan to buy more mobile airtime credits to sell. This will help her community connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. 

Ela’s goal regarding Ruma is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community. Ruma’s latest product is called Mapan. Ela is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell.

loans.name: Joyvelyn

texts.en:
Joyvelyn is a merchant from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. 

Joyvelyn sells clothing like pants, dresses and shirts, under garments, shoes and sandals. Joyvelyn has been in the business for more than 10 years. 

Joyvelyn is asking for a loan to buy more clothing. A loan will enable her to improve her stock and sell more items to her customers. 

In the future, Joyvelyn hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase various supplies and merchandise for her accessory business. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 50000 PHP loan to buy accessories such as hats, headbands, phone and CD casing, toys, hairpins and some clothes which she sells at retail. 

Erlinda knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and increase her earnings. She also has a fruits shake stand to earn extra income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help. A good return on her investment will surely help her sustain sustenance her family and help her provide for her child's college education. 

Erlinda dreams of having a bigger general accessories store and to improve her family's quality of living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.
----------------------------------------------------
 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy accessories and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for accessories and spare parts to maintain her van. Her rental service business helped meet her family's daily living expenses. 

Now, she would now like to apply for a 50000 PHP loan to keep her van in continuously good running condition. It is very important that her van is always running to ensure efficient and safe service for her clients. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given as this will help her family.

Valentina hopes to serve her clients well and wants to buy another van in the future. She prays for the safety of her driver and their passengers. 

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .
------------------------------------
 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts to maintain her van.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 28 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marivel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Marivel has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es:
Sara, de 40 años de edad, reside desde hace once años en el mismo lugar con su familia, es originaria de otro municipio donde se creció, trabajando en la caficultura y la siembra de granos básicos desde pequeña, es madre de cinco hijos, dos de los cuales estudian nivel básico, los mayores ya tienen sus propias familias; su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ganadería y además hace viajes en un vehículo a la ciudad.- Ella, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a los problemas que acarreo el país en los años ochenta y estaba alejada de la comunidad.

Sara, trabaja en la comercialización de venta de ropa, negocio que emprendió hace once años, gracias a que una de sus primas le enseño, desde entonces está dedicada al negocio, vende los días sábados y domingos en la ciudad y lugares aledaños a la zona donde reside, compra mercadería cada 15 días en la ciudad.

También, los días de semana venden atol, enchiladas, tostadas, yuca, pan y otros antojitos, de donde obtiene ingresos económicos, para apoyar a su familia.- Ella trabaja sola, a veces su hija le ayuda a vender en la comunidad, además vende productos de lencerías, lo hace a través de revistas.- Junto con su esposo trabaja la agricultura y la crianza de ganado en pequeña escala.

Sara, solicita el crédito para comprar dos novillas, el resto del dinero lo necesita para comprar ropa para todas las edades, de donde pretende seguir obteniendo buenos resultados económicos para su familia.- En el terreno donde tiene la casa, tiene pasto sembrado, gracias a que hay una fuente de agua cerca y además compra concentrado para la alimentación del ganado.

Sara, sueña con comprar más ganado, para aumentar el número de ganado y poder producir más leche y venderla en la comunidad.- Además, está dentro de sus planes, seguir apoyando a su hija para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Sara, 40, has lived in the same place with her family for 10 years.  She is a native of another municipality where she grew up working in the coffee fields and cultivating staple grains from the time she was a child.  She is a mother of 5, one of whom studies in the local elementary school.  Her husband works in agriculture and livestock production, and he also makes trips in a vehicle to the city.  He lives with Sara and their 5 children.

Sara works selling clothing in a business that she started up eleven years ago, thanks to one of her cousins who taught her the business.  She works on Saturdays and Sundays in the town and neighboring communities. She travels into town twice monthly to buy the merchandise.  Also during the week Sara sells atol (drink made from corn), enchiladas, toast, cassava, bread and other snacks. The money she earns helps support her family.  Generally she works alone but sometimes her daughter helps her with sales in the community. Sara also sells underwear from catalog, and together with her husband, she works the land and raises livestock on a small scale.

Sara is requesting a loan to buy 2 heifers and to buy clothing for all ages.  She plans to continue to get good financial results for her family.  On the land where they have their home they have pasture grass, thanks to the fact that there is a source of water nearby.  With this loan, they will also buy cattle feed.

Sara dreams of buying more cattle to increase their stock.  This way, they could produce more milk and have more to sell to the community.  In addition, according to their plans, they will continue to support their daughter so that she can stay in school.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 57, is a sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has two grown children. Leonila has operated her store for more than three years now. Leonila is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments. The loan will be used to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Leonila hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has a hog raising business. Maricel has just recently sold the pigs that she raised. Now she is requesting another loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 48 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soft drinks, sardines, diapers and other groceries.

Veronica has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing retail and a pig fattening businesses.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase items like soft drinks, sardines, diapers and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adonay Amilcar

texts.es:
Adonay, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado en la comunidad, no siguió estudiando por falta de recursos económicos, es padre de una niña que estudia quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a trabajar con un molino nixtamal y le apoya a él en la crianza de especies menores.- Adonay, creció trabajando con sus padres, en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijoles, hortalizas y otros).

Adonay, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace cinco años; ademas cultiva hortalizas y granos básicos como (maíz y frijoles) en las temporadas; por las noches trabaja de vigilante, en un negocio que está en la ciudad y tiene que viajar por una hora en el transporte urbano.

Adonay, necesita el crédito para comprar 200 pollos de engorde y comprar concentrado, para que crezcan sanos y poder engordarlos para vender.- Además, quiere mejorar las instalaciones y comprar dos bebederos para la alimentación de los pollos; de esta manera podrá asegurar la alimentación de su familia y obtener otros ingresos para su hogar.

Adonay, sueña con incrementar poco a poco la producción, pues quiere darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.- También, dentro de sus planes está hacer otra galera más, para aumentar el número de pollos de engorde y llevarlos escalonados para tener siempre producto.
texts.en:
Adonay is 33 years old, and he studied until the ninth grade. He did not continue studying due to the lack of financial resources. He is the father of a daughter that is studying in the fifth grade. He is married, and his wife works at a corn mill and supports him in raising small animals. Adonay grew up working with his parents planting basic grains, corn, beans, vegetables, and other crops.

Adonay has earned a living raising broiler chickens for five years. He also grows vegetables and basic grains like corn and beans in their seasons. At night he works as a guard for a business that is in the city, and to reach it he has to travel for one hour on public transportation.

Adonay is requesting a loan to buy 200 broiler chickens and buy feed so that they grow healthy and he can raise them to sell. He also wants to improve their facilities and buy two drinking fountains for the feeding of the chickens. In this manner he will be able to assure the feeding of his own family and receive an income for his home. 

Adonay dreams of increasing his production little by little because he wants to give his family a better quality of life. Also, among his plans is the making of another chicken coop to increase the number of broiler chickens and raise them in stages in order to always have a product.

loans.use: to buy 200 broiler chickens and buy feed so that they grow healthy and he can raise them to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase damask fabrics and dyes

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en: Casimera is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. Her husband is a motorized-tricycle driver. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various items like coffee, sugar, eggs, powdered milk, seasonings, toiletries and other commodities. Casimera has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted items for her store. These will be a big help for Casimera and her family to improve the stock of her store. With the additional items, her income will increase to meet her family's expenses. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cucumbers and zucchini

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Dora Yamileth

texts.es:
Dora, de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña que estudia nivel básico, en el municipio más cercano y tiene que ir a dejarla y ha traerla de lunes a viernes por las mañanas, actualmente vive solo con su hija y su madre a quien cuida, ella estudio hasta sexto grado y dejo de estudiar, porque tenia que trabajar para ayudar a su madre con el trabajo de la casa.
