Dora, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde que tenía quince años de edad y también vende lociones y cremas y es de ahí de donde ella obtiene ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a su hija y ayudar a su madre; sale a vender tres o cuatro días a la semana, en las comunidades aledañas.

Dora, solicita un crédito para comprar ropa para todas las edades y tambien cremas, lociones y otros productos, para vender en la comunidad.- Esto le ayudará mucho, pues espera obtener ingresos económicos buenos, para alimentar a su familia.

Dora, sueña con seguir apoyando a su hija en los estudios, para que logre culminar sus estudios en la escuela y siga en la universidad.- Además, espera con sus pequeños ahorros comprar en el futuro un lote de tierra para construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 30 years old. She is a single mother of a young girl who is in elementary school in the nearest city to their home. Dora has to go there to drop her off and pick her up Monday through Friday in the mornings. Currently, Dora lives alone with her daughter and her mother, who she takes care of. Dora has a seventh grade education. She had to leave school to work and help her mother with the work at home. 

Dora makes a living selling clothing. She has worked like this since she was 15. She also sells lotions and creams. From this she earns income to help her daughter and her mother. Dora goes out to sell her products three or four days a week in the surrounding communities.

Dora is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing for all ages, as well as lotions, creams and other products to sell in the community. This will be a great help to her. It will help her obtain good profits from which to feed her family.

Dora dreams of supporting her daughter in her education so that she finishes school and goes on to the university. Furthermore, she hopes that her small savings will one day buy a plot of land on which to build a home.

loans.use: to buy clothing for all ages and creams, lotions, and other products to sell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 19-seat bus to drive

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
Nair es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 9 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas.
Ella es buen madre, emprendedora, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el origen de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, que se ubicaron al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todo el país se asentaron en el lugar y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-36 grados centígrados.
Nair es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los negocios que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste blusa roja). Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de bebé, venta de carteras de cuero, servicio de transporte, venta de baterías de vehículos, venta de comida, ferretería, venta de desayunos y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas, fritas de; Jamón y Queso, Queso, Charque, Cerdo, Dulce de Leche, Fricase, Pollo, mariscos y Mixtas, el menú del día depende de los ingredientes de temporada. Su labor diaria consiste en preparar y hornear deliciosas empanadas para luego venderlas de forma ambulante en distintos mercados y comercios del lugar. Su actividad por las noches es la de manicura, trabaja en un salón de belleza realizando el cuidado de las manos de sus clientes; “realizo ambas actividades para juntar el dinero para el gasto de mis hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de ambas actividades es que el horario no se cruza, la desventaja es que trabaja todos los días de la semana sin descanso. Su sueño es abrir un snack de comida y abrir un salón de belleza, ella desea realizar una inversión en ambas actividades realizando la compra de harina e insumos de cocina como; aceite y otros por mayor, y también realizando la compra de equipo de manicura como; cortaúñas, corta cutículas, acetona, cremas, aceites y otros, para activar ambos negocios e independizarse. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Nair solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para su negocio de empanadas y material de manicura para su segunda actividad.
texts.en:
Nair is a 34 year-old woman. She is single and has three children ages 6, 9 and 12. Her business is the sale of empanadas. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, patient, friendly, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the area 'Plan 3000' which is known for the origin of its population, the Aymarás, the Quechuas and the Guaraníes that moved to the southern part of the city. Migrants from all over the country settled in this place and started a large trade. It has a warm tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 18 and 36 degrees Celsius during the day.

Nair has dark skin, long brown hair that she wears tied up, brown eyes, short in stature, and has a robust physique (she is on the right-hand side in the red shirt). Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish with the general public and in her business. She lives her life together with her children that are in school. They live in their own space made of brick and cement with a metal roof, and they have potable water, electricity, and gas. 

The group's desires to get ahead have brought them to form a group of people to request a loan to strengthen their businesses. There are businesses such as selling baby clothes, selling leather purses, transportation services, selling vehicle batteries, selling food, a hardware store, selling breakfast foods, and selling second-hand clothing. 

Nair's business is the sale of fried empanadas including: ham and cheese, cheese, shredded beef, pork, dulce de leche, sauteed meat, seafood, and mixed. The menu changes by day depending on the ingredients at the time. Her daily work consists of preparing and baking delicious empanadas to then sell as a street vendor in different markets and trades in the area. At night she is a manicurist. She works in a beauty salon taking care of the hands of her clients. She states, "I work both jobs every day to make money for my children's expenses." The advantage of both jobs is that the schedules do not cross, and the downside is that she works every day of the week without rest.

Her dream is to open a food stall and open a beauty salon. She would like to invest in both activities by buying flour and kitchen supplies like oil and other items at wholesale, and also buy a manicure set with nail clippers, cuticle cutters, nail polish remover, lotions, oils, and other items in order to push forward with both businesses and become independent. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the four years that she has worked both jobs.

For these reasons Nair is requesting a loan to buy kitchen supplies for her empanada business and manicure material for her second job.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for her empanada business and manicure material for her second job.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en: Maria Victoria is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Maria Victoria is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments. Maria Victoria hopes to expand her store in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 59 years old, married, and she has four children. She is engaged in banana farming to help her husband provide for the family. She needs financial assistance to pay the labor costs to harvest her bananas and plant new banana trees. Esterlita wants to improve her living condition and save money from her business.

loans.use: to hire laborers for her banana farm.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines, and is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. 

She supplements this income with earnings from farming vegetables and pig fattening.

Marlyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera y se dedica a la costureria, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales ya no viven con ella.

María, se dedica a confeccionar ropa, en este momento se encarga de hacer uniformes escolares y los vende hechos, ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio después que se quedo desempleada, luego tomó un curso de sastrería y ahora coloco su propio negocio en su casa.

María, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como: hilo, telas, botones y adornos para mejorar su negocio, por que con el crédito ella podrá compra sus productos por mayoreo.

El sueño principal de María, es que en un futuro poder comprar otra maquina de cocer y así poder agilizar más el trabajo y poder emplear a otra persona.
texts.en:
María, 63 years old, studied through the 7th grade. She is a single mother who makes a living as a seamstress. María has three children who do not live with her. 

María works making clothing. Currently, she is charged with producing school uniforms, which she sells. María decided to take up this business because she was unemployed and took a course in tailoring. Now she has her own workshop in her home. 

María is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of basic items such as thread, fabric, buttons, and decorations that will help to improve her business. With this loan she will be able to buy supplies in bulk.

María's dream is to be able to buy a sewing machine and be able to take on more work orders and hire another person.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as thread, fabric, buttons, and decorations to improve her business.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es:
Luisa, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, tiene 1 niño de 2 años de edad y su pareja se dedica a vender frutas y verduras.

Luisa, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, frutas, verduras y pescado, ella lo aprendió en una cooperativa donde anteriormente trabajo, desde su casa se desplaza a vender en el cantón.

Luisa, solicita el crédito para comprar una hielera y surtir de productos y mariscos su venta, con el dinero restante reparará su casa.

El sueño principal de Luisa, es comprar 2 vacas en un futuro y que su hijo logre estudiar y que se convierta en un profesional.
texts.en:
Luisa is 22 years old. She finished high school and is now married with one 2-year-old son. Her husband works selling fruits and vegetables.

Luisa makes a living selling soft drinks, fruit, vegetables, and fish. She learned this trade in a cooperative where she used to work. She goes out from her home to sell her products throughout the canton.

Luisa is requesting this loan in order to buy a freezer and more stock of her products and seafood to sell. With the remaining money she will make some home repairs.

Luisa's dream is to buy 2 cows in the future. She also dreams that her son will be able to finish his education and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock of her products and seafood to sell.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, de 62 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado académico, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos y a la elaboración de tortillas para vender, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 24 y 19 años de edad, quienes se dedican a la pesca artesanal en una laguna y también siembran granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. 

Berta, conoce muy bien las actividad que desempeña, pues las ejerce desde hace 14 años, lo que le ha permitió dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar hasta nivel medio; el producto que sus hijos obtiene de la pesca, ella lo comercializa y es así como ella obtiene ingresos.  

Berta, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortilla para vender y poder cubrir sus necesidades.    

Berta,  tiene como sueño, mejorara su vivienda, para mayor seguridad de todos y colocar un negocio más grande, que le permita ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Berta, 62 years old, did not go to school. She makes a living as a domestic servant and producing tortillas to sell. Berta lives with her two children ages 24 and 1. They work as specialty fisherman in the lake and grow basic grains for the family to eat.

Berta is very knowledgeable about her trade. She began working 14 years ago. She was not able to put her children through school. What her children catch fishing she sells to obtain income. 

Berta needs this loan in order to buy corn to make tortillas to sell and to pay for necessary items. 

Berta's dream is to improve her home so that it is safer for everyone and to expand her business. This will allow her to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman who has been doing hand embroidery work for about eight years. She makes beautiful patterns and designs using her skill. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to her family's income. To help her continue her business, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy more thread in different colors, beads, sequins and stones. With these items, she will be able to cater to more customers and increase her income. Naseem's dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Jorgelina Soledad

texts.es:
Jorgelina se dedica a la costura, es una persona muy sacrificada que viene esforzándose por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar una nueva maquina de coser, y con ello poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder una nueva maquina de coser industrial, que le permitirá poder mejorar su producción para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorgelina is a seamstress. She is a self-sacrificing person who strives to provide her family all of the things that she was not able to have. Jorgelina say that her previous loan was used to buy a new sewing machine. This allowed her to fulfill the orders from her customers.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy a new industrial sewing machine. This will enable her to improve her production so that she can satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy a new industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, vive en casa familiar de material rústico que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Santo Tomás, una comunidad pequeña habitada por gente amable y dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro del comercio y cria de ganado vacuno y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Adicionalmente cultiva café variedad catimore y otros productos como yuca, camote, menestras, etc. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para incrementar su negocio, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old. She has a stable home with her husband and their two children. Their family's rustic home is located in the Santo Tomás province, It is a small community with kind people who work in agriculture, business, and raising livestock. The community is located in Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region, in the north of Perú. 

Ana makes a living raising and selling cattle. She has much experience in this work. She raises calves and has very good references from the people in her district. Additionally, Ana cultivates coffee and other products such as yuca, root vegetables, and other vegetables. 

Ana will use this loan to buy more cattle to expand her business. With this, she will obtain better income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es: A sus 56 años de edad Rosalvina está casada se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el esposo de Rosalvina  trabaja al jornal, Rosalvina y su esposo tiene 7 hijos,  los 3 hijos menores que están en las edades de 15, 22 y 25 aun viven con Rosalvina, los demás ya son independientes, Rosalvina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y comenta que por medio de este negocio es como ha apoyado a su esposo y han sacado a sus hijos adelante pero que no les alcanzo para darles la educación por este motivo sus hijos trabajan en el jornal, Rosalvina necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos y incrementar su negocio, Rosalvina aspira seguir trabajando y  asi sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalvina is 56 years old and married. She works raising small animals and her husband works as a day laborer. Rosalvina and her husband have seven children, the three youngest are 15, 22, and 25 years old and still live with Rosalvina. The other children are independent.

Rosalvina works raising small animals. Through this business she has supported her husband and they have gotten their children ahead, but it was not enough for them to give their children an education. For this reason, her children work as day laborers. Rosalvina needs the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs to increase her business. Rosalvina aspires to continue working and in that way get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 70, knows very well what she wants for her life and she has decided to be a full time mixed farmer. She resides in the Kitale area of Kenya. She has seven lovely and adorable children whom she really values and treasures. She always refers to them as "her heartbeat." 

Jane has been farming for the past 25 years and through hard work and determination, she has been able to support her family and always provide a plate of food for them. Her main sources of income come from milk, poultry, crops and a small personal business that she does to make ends meet. 

Due to harsh living conditions and the lack of employment, Jane plans to increase her farming output so that she can improve her income and, hence, her living conditions. That is why she is seeking a loan of 55,000 KES to buy farm inputs. Through buying farming inputs, such as good-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticide, she will be able to increase her crop output and, hence, improve her income. 

Jane is very visionary and enterprising and she hopes that, through improved income, she will be able to save more money. She plans to buy more land and increase her farming in the future. Through this loan, her business will continue to flourish and she will assure her grandchildren of uninterrupted learning because she will pay tuition fees for them on time and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business, trading cloth for many years to support her family. Her husband's income is not enough to provide for his family alone, so she decided to start her business. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Kousar requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of summer cloth in different colors and styles, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy summer cloth in different colors and styles, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia   Yobana pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas
texts.en:
Yobana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She continues to manage a grocery business. Yobana is a responsible and diligent individual. She has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Yobana wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sodas, snack foods, and other products. Yobana appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snack foods, and other products.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Sheila Mae requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Sheila Mae has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is a 35-year-old married woman with five children who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ramonita has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more crab, oysters, shrimp, etc. to sell.

Ramonita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crab, oysters, shrimp, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns and designs for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has maintained a good client list that allows her to contribute to her family’s income.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. Having these materials, she would be able to meet all of her orders on time. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. Therefore, she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Some years ago Khursheed began stitching work in her house. She provides a stitching facility for the people living around her house, and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, Khursheed is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore, she has borrowed 55,000 PKR from Kashf.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including threads of different color, laces, zips, buttons etc. to meet all orders on time and create a means of increasing revenue. In this way, Khursheed will be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including threads of different color, laces, zips, buttons etc. to meet all orders on time.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 33-year-old married woman who has been a hand embroiderer for many years. She makes beautiful patterns and designs using her skill. Her designs are high in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to fulfilling the expenses of her family members. 

To help her continue her operations, Perveen requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers, and she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is single and wants to earn income to help his parents. He runs a transport business, and it was a growing business for him because he earned PHP 3,000 a month. Recently, he decided to take another loan to purchase motor parts for motor maintenance.

Randy wants to give his parents a better living.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Carolain

texts.es:
Carolain es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de medicamentos en una farmacia.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘La Merced’ ubicada al norte de la ciudad donde se encuentra la terminal de buses con destino a poblaciones al norte del departamento, de clima frío y seco con fuertes vientos que provienen de la cordillera, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Carolain es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que trabaja y junto a su bebé. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos y artículos de farmacia, como; antigripales, bloqueador solares, antiácidos, curitas, algodón, cremas, preservativos, aspirinas, etc. Labor que realiza en su domicilio en horas del día durante toda la semana. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y cuidar a mi bebé, soy dueña y administro mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que le permite cuidar y disfrutar a su bebé, la desventaja es que no cuenta con seguro social y no aporta para su jubilación. Su sueño es construir una casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora para cubrir la necesidad de un colegio que se encuentra al frente de su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carolain solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora para cubrir la necesidad del colegio de enfrente de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carolain is a 27-year-old woman. She is single and has a 3-year-old son. Her business is the sale of medicine in a pharmacy. She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, patient, tenacious, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the ‘La Merced’ zone located in the north of the city where the bus terminal is found with destination to the towns in the northern area of the department. It is a cold and dry climate with strong winds that come from the mountains, with a temperature that varies during the day between 4-16 degrees Celsius.

Carolain has dark complexion, long dark hair that she ties back, brown eyes, short stature, and a thin build. Her primary language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for her business.

She shares her life with her mother who works and with her baby. They live in their own room made of brick with a metal roof that has potable water, electricity, gas, and a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of medicine and pharmacy items such as: flu vaccine, sunscreen, antacids, bandaids, cotton, creams, prophylactics, aspirin, etc.  She works from her home during the daytime all week. “I started my business due to the need to work and care for my baby. I am the owner and I run my business…” she says. The advantage of her business is that it allows her to take care of and enjoy her baby. The disadvantage is that she does not have social security and it does not contribute to her retirement. Her dream is to build her own home.

She wants to buy a photocopy machine to cover the needs of a school that is found in front of her business. This is the second loan sequence with the institution in three years that she comes carrying out this business. For those reasons, Carolain requests a loan to buy a photocopy machine to cover the needs of the school in front of her business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine to cover the needs of the school in front of her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 39-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, and a mother of five children.  Jocelyn makes a living through retail sales of various goods and food items. She also provides electronic prepaid loading services for mobile phones.  

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments.  A loan will help her improve her stock, thereby attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair one of his vehicles

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
Rolando José tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, y gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante e invertir en su negocio, con la compra de insumos agrícolas, como: semillas de trigo, maíz, frijoles, abono, etc. Además, con las ganancias de la venta de sus productos ha podido mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
Para continuar invirtiendo en sus cultivos, solicita un credito para comprar más granos, abonos y fertilizantes. Además, ese dinero le ayudará  para pagarles a los ayudantes.  Entre los planes a futuro de Rolando esta comprar un panel solar y continuar mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rolando José has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to move forward and invest in his business. He intends to purchase farming supplies such as wheat seeds, corn seeds, bean seeds, compost, and other items. With the earnings from the sale of his products, he will also make improvements to the infrastructure of his home.

In order to continue investing in his crops, Rolando José is requesting a loan in order to buy more seeds, compost, and fertilizers. In addition, the money will be used to pay his assistants. Among his future plans, Rolando will buy a solar panel and continue to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, compost, fertilizers, and the wages of his assistants.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

Gina has been farming sugarcane for ten years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborers.

loans.name: 027G348221

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. Elizabeth hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a married woman with three children. She is 29 years old and all three of her children are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jovy has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Jovy requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell like crabs, shrimp, oysters and other seafood.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell like crabs, shrimp, oysters and other seafood.

loans.name: Lurlyn

texts.en:
Lurlyn is 25 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lurlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Lurlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 63 years old and married with seven children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, diapers, school uniforms and other groceries. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from selling rice. Corazon has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Corazon aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, diapers, school uniforms and other groceries.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a vigorous 44-year-old married lady. She is the mother of four children. She has been manufacturing rugs for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade rugs in different colors and designs and makes enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, threads, cutters, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and her dream is to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, threads, cutters, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana tiene 44 años de edad, Juana está casada y tiene 9 hijos, de las edades de 18, 16,14, 12, 10, 8, 5, 3 años de edad y el menor de 8 meses, de los mismos que 7 están estudiando, el esposo de Juana se dedica a trabajar al jornal y de albañil, Juana se dedica a la crianza animales menores y comenta que es asi como tiene sus ingresos para darles la educación a sus hijos, Juana necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, Juana vive en la casa de su suegra y Juana  tiene la aspiración de  seguir adelante en su negocio y de alguna manera mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is 44 years old and is married. She has nine children, ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 5, 3 and 8 months old. Of her children, seven are in school. 

Her husband makes a living in construction, and Juana makes a living raising and breeding small animals. She explained that this is how she makes an income to give her children an education.   

Juana needs a loan to invest in buying chickens. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house and aspires to get ahead in her business and in some way improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 49-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. Irshad buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

Irshad makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income, but she needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, Irshad has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more baby goats and calves, in order to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves, in order to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Malook

texts.en: Malook is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been doing business selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, plates, bowls, etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. In this way she will be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, soup sets, dinner sets, platters, etc. in different sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wants to use part of her income on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, soup sets, dinner sets, platters, etc. in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es de la ciudad de Concepción, es una estudiante que está luchando por ser alguien en la vida, y ayudar a sus padres por medio de sus estudios.
Ella quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad por medio de su carrera, la cual es la de contabilidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder para sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Veronica is from the city of Concepción. She is a student who is striving to make something out of her life. Veronica want to help her parents through her studies.

With a degree in Accounting, she also wants to help other people in society. Veronica is requesting this loan so that she can pay her fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the conditions of the rooms that she rents in order to provide her tenants better conditions and in that way maintain her clientele.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Esmilce

texts.es:
La  Sra. Esmilce tiene 31 años  está casada  con el señor Saturnino de 36 años, tienen un hijo, por el cual ambos están esforzándose para poder darle un futuro sin privaciones.
Anteriormente fue empleada, pero con los años y esfuerzo y utilizando las tierras que posee se decidió a montar un tambo dedicandose a la venta de leche, su marido es empleado de una empresa y también la ayuda para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados varios para sus vacas, con lo cual podrá seguir con su tambo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmilce is 31 years old and is married to Sr. Saturnino, age 36. They have a child, so both of them strive to provide a future without deprivation.

Esmilce previously worked as an employee. However, after years of utilizing the land that she owned, she decided to establish a farm dedicated to the sale of milk. Her husband is employed at a company and helps out in order to improve their family’s quality of life.

Esmilce is requesting this loan so that she can buy various types of balanced feed for her cows. This will keep her dairy farm running just as before.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She also earns an additional income through hog raising.

Myrna is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and also to buy additional piglets to raise. Myrna believes that a loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Myrna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and also to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 30 year old married woman with two children aged 5 and 6 year old.

Marjorie earns a living by selling sea cucumbers. They are used in fresh or dried form in various cuisines. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which helps her to meet their daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more sea cucumbers. With these, she would be able to sell a higher volume of sea cucumbers, and possibly generate more sales.

Marjorie hopes that she will expand her business to become productive and able to finance the schooling of all her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumbers.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofe tiene 47 años de edad, vive con esposo en casa propia en el distrito Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, desde hace 6 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría, con esto ella espera obtener mejores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Cleofe is 47 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. They reside in the District of Oyotún, a community that is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is situated in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Cleofe raises and sells farm animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. She has been doing this for six years and her business is located at her home. Cleofe has experience in this business and her customers have given very good references on her behalf. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a large quantity of animals so that she can increase her business. In addition, she will make repairs to the place where the animals are kept. Cleofe hopes to generate better earnings so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and to make repairs to the animal pens.

loans.name: Narcela

texts.en:
Narcela is a 51-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Narcela has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Narcela requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Narcela has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 34-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs, oysters, shrimp and other seafood to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs, oysters, shrimp and other seafood to sell

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ledesma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years. Ledesma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

In the future, Ledesma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Opalyn

texts.en:
Opalyn is a married woman with two children. She is 30 years old and both her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Opalyn has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Opalyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell on her stall.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy works hard to support her family. Cristy is single and has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Cristy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like body lotion, perfume, make up and other personal care product.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products like body lotion, perfume, make up and other personal care product

loans.name: Juana Marleni

texts.es:
Juana, esta teniendo mayor demanda de su servicio como cosmetóloga y necesita de capital para comprar tintes, esmaltes, mascarillas, cremas corporales, maquillaje, entre otros productos de belleza para atender mejor a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ha sido de apoyo para que su negocio este más surtido y que tenga sus ingresos incrementen un poco, los cuales ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de vida y en cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Juana is experiencing more demand for her cosmetology services, so she needs capital to buy dyes, nail polishes, mascaras, body crèmes, make-up, and other beauty products so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Her previous loan was a great help to her business. She acquired more inventory and her profits increased slightly. As a result, she was able to invest in improvements to her living conditions and the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polishes, mascaras, body crèmes, make-up, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 58 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for twenty years and also earns additional income from general store. Remedios is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gloria has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Gloria requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money in order to increase her family's income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Juvy works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending and nipa roofing businesses.

Juvy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 55-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. Rasheedan buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

Rasheedan makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Rasheedan needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 51-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows, which she uses to produce milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.

Kousar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow and to increase her milk sales to more customers.

Kousar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and increase her milk sales to more customers.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena has successfully built her business selling garments with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. The man shown in the picture is her husband who helps her in her business by selling garments door to door in their nearby area.

At the present time, they have attained a good number of customers and make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva they were able to expand their business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more variety of garments in different sizes and designs. This will enable her to increase their sales to more customers and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of garments in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 50-year-old married woman, who has been running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They have two buffaloes, which they use for the purpose of milk selling. 

Shameem looks after the cattle and is responsible for providing them food, while her husband sells milk door to door to the people of their locality. They have become famous for providing good quality milk, and generate enough revenue through their business to support their family well. 

Now they want to expand their business, therefore Shameem has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow them to purchase one more buffalo to increase their sales in more areas. Shameem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for them and will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase their sales in more areas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara en su vida de estudiante es muy sacrificada, por el hecho de trasladarse todos los días grandes distancias para poder estudiar.
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, y con mucho esfuerzo está luchando para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Clara is a student who has made many sacrifices in her life. For example, she has to commute great distances in order to be able to study.

Clara is studying for a degree in Commercial Engineering. With great effort, she is striving to help her family. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. As a result, she can continue striving to make something out of her life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería y a la elaboración   de productos lácteos como yogurt y queso, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She divides her time among her daily activities, raising livestock, and making dairy products such as yogurt and cheese. The borrower is a responsible and diligent individual. She has been in business for quite some time. Thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business, she has been able to help her family get ahead.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow. She is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business, so she promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mikongeni Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running a genge duka for 12 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Grace's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the genge stock, and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the out-of-stock items and the fast-moving items in her genge.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Grace will share this loan with her loan group "Mikongeni," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out-of-stock items and the fast-moving items in her genge.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living and help her husband to provide for the needs of her children, she engaged in and owns a fishing net business. She wants to earn more income, and to make it happen, she decided again to take a loan to purchase materials for the additional fish net, so that she can catch more fish to sell.

Mary Ann is hoping to expand her business and save money from her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the additional fishnet.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sylvia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and clothing sales businesses. 

Sylvia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 41 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Eleonor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Eleonor has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Eleonor aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anna Lisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Anna Lisa works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

Anna Lisa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and other equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

Anna Lisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and other equipment for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jene is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Jene has a chainsaw services business in the Philippines. Jene requested a PHP 37,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her chainsaw business.

Jene has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Jene would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her chainsaw business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Sylvia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Sylvia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto operates a tricycle transportation service. He transports passengers from one place to a remote area. He is a 39-year-old married man with two dependents aged 10 and 7 year old.

He is asking for a loan to buy fuel, tire and other maintenance for his tricycle. His operation will be hassle free and help passengers arrive at their respective work places ahead of time. His income will improve and he will be able to set aside some of the savings. He could provide his family with nutritious diets. He is hoping that he could pay for the registration of his tricycle.

 He dreams of expanding his livelihood to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fuel, tire and other maintenance  for his tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 35-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three children who attend school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and they cooperate together in order to fulfill their needs.  She has been working as a private teacher since 2010. She adores her profession, because she helps the students to get a good education. She has organized a particular room at her domicile where she receives students, and has outfitted it with the necessary materials. 

Today, she is applying for a second loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase a scientific encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills, and therefore increase her income. She wishes to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a scientific encyclopedia.

loans.name: Marcelita Gregoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Tosagueñas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Marcelita, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos. El marido no trabaja por motivos de salud. 
Doña Marcelita para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar hace varios años construyo una pequeña graja en su casa donde se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra los pollos pequeños para luego alimentarlos y cuidarlos por tres meses tiempo necesario para que estén listos para la venta, los vende a vecinos del lugar o a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animales. Así ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido lleva años sin poder trabajar.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios adicionales que ofrece la institución como el seguro médico gratuito. Sus sueños son seguir contando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Women’s Credit Group of Tosagua meets every 15 days. This area is known for being very dynamic where the majority of its residents make a living through agriculture and raising animals – for it’s an area with much vegetation. 

Ms. Marcelita lives in the area. She is 51 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has six older children – two of whom still live with them. Her husband does not work due to health reasons. 

In order to help her husband with household expenses that are generated, several years ago Ms. Marcelita built a small structure in her home dedicated to raising chickens. 

She purchases small chickens in order to then feed and raise them for three months time so that they are ready to sell. She sells them to neighbors in the area or merchants that come to her house to buy the animals. Thus, she earns enough to support them in getting ahead, as her husband has spent years unable to work. 

This loan is for buying feed and medicine for the chickens. Since the credit group started, she has liked the additional services the institution offers like free health insurance. Her dream is to continue on with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Martha Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Tosagueñas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 21 y 12 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos viven con ella. Su esposo es ayudante en un bus de transporte.
Doña Matha al ver que su marido no gana mucho y no alcanza para los gastos, hace mas de 5  años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí empezó a vender solo  productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres primarios, y después con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos, ella también vende productos naturales, ventas que realiza en su tienda o sale a recorrer por la localidad. Así ella logra sus propios ingresos que los utiliza para el estudio de su hijo ya que espera que el sea un gran profesional.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y productos naturales. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the “Grupo De Credito Mujeres Tosaguenas” meets every fifteen days.  It is a place known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and the raising of animals since it is an area with lush vegetation.

This is where Martha lives.  She is 40 years old, married, and from this relationship they have three children who are 22, 21 and 12 years of age.  The youngest is studying in school.  Two of her children live with her.  Her husband is an attendant on a transport bus.

On seeing that her husband didn't earn much and the money didn't stretch to pay the expenses, 5 years ago Martha started a small convenience store in her house.  There she began just selling products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergents among other primary provisions.  Later, with the help of loans, she has added a variety of products.  She also sells natural products, sales that she realizes at her store or by going out into the town. 

In this way she gets her own income that she uses for her son's studies since she hopes that he will be a great professional.

This loan is going to be used to further supply her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and natural products.  She has had 5 loan cycles with the “Grupo Credito” and she likes it because with the loans she has improved her business.  Her goal is to continue adding more to her store every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and natural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to supply more milk to his customers and to increase his income.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

Beverly has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Forinfda

texts.en:
Forinfda works hard to support her family. Forinfda is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Forinfda has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Leonida has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is married and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns income from welding shop and beauty products businesses. Carmel is borrowing 45,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Carmel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gina works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives on a hilltop in Nandi Hills, Kenya with her husband and their three children. She can see a bright future, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. Beatrice passionately loves dairy farming. Because of the immense farming knowledge she has, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers. 

However, the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions, and be able to secure the future of her children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. Beatrice is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting the life of her family and children. Please consider lending to Beatrice.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc., for her business.

Analiza has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy broccoli, bananas, cabbages, papayas, tomatoes, and other produce.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old, married and has three children.  

Mary is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary  requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is ambitious, admirable, and a hard-worker who wants to triumph. She wants to leave her mark on the world. At 25 years old, she is independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others.

Stella owns a 0.8 acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted 30 trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. The land provides her with not only capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have two children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for five years!

Stella is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Stella's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests.

Your loan will directly elevate Stella’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in.

loans.use: to buy cereal seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them and has run a general store for 15 years. She requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar.

In the future Gloria would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 58-year-old married woman with five children.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 35 years and requests 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase snack food, diapers, soap and other groceries.

Mary has borrowed and repaid 22 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from clothing sales.

Mary aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  snack food, diapers, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 49 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc.

Viola has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soda, bread, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, realiza los oficios domésticos de su casa y vende ropa, esta actividad la ha desarrollado desde hace 10 años tiene 2 hijos, de 9 y 11 años de edad, ellos se encuentran estudiando, está acompañada y vive junto a su esposo que es albañil. 
 
María, vende ropa desde hace varios años, lo que le permitió dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, ella realiza la venta de ropa 3 veces por semana y recorre varios caseríos de la zona, dicha actividad la aprendió por medio de una amiga que también vendía ropa.- Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja.

María, utilizará el dinero del préstamo para comprar más productos para la venta, comprará diferentes tallas y colores de ropa.

María, sueña con una mejor estabilidad económica y un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
María, 31 years old, studied through high school. She does the household chores and sells clothing, a business she developed 10 years ago. She has two children, 9 and 11 years old, who are in school. She lives with her husband that is a bricklayer.  

For several years, María has sold clothing – which has allowed her to give her children the opportunity to study. She sells clothing three times a week and travels to various rural villages in the area. She learned this business through a friend that also sells clothing, and she relies upon the support of her partner. 

María will use the loan to purchase more products to sell, including different sizes and colors of clothing. 

María dreams of having better economic stability and a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy different sizes and colors of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open his own business by buying a computer, a printer and some furniture for his new office.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her to provide for her children's educational expenses and to pay for their daily needs.

Helen is very positive that she can further improve her business if you will lend her 40,000 PHP. This new loan will pay for additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Helen's customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, Helen could sustain the needs of her family.

Helen hopes to grow her profit more and dreams of expanding her store. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefina Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Tosagueñas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefina, tiene 51 años de edad, esta separada pero de ese relación tiene siete  hijos, 4 mayores de edad y tres de 17, 15  y 12  años, los tres menores  estudian en un colegio de la localidad.
