Doña Josefina con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres,  ella tiene un local en el mercado de la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde la madrugada que recibe la mercadería de mayoristas hasta las 19h00 que se va a su casa a descansar, a ella le ayudan sus hijos los fines de semana que es cuando más ventas tiene,  lleva más de 20 años dedicada al comercio ya que es algo que le encanta realizar y es como se gana el sustento para ella y sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre a la vez.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Women’s Credit Group of Tosagua meets every 15 days. The area is known for being very dynamic where the majority of its residents make a living through agriculture and raising animals – for it’s an area with much vegetation. 

Ms. Josefina lives in this area. She is 51 years old and is separated. But, from this relationship she has seven children, four older children and three who are 17, 15 and 12 years old. The youngest three are studying at a local school.  

In order to earn a living and be able to get ahead in life, Ms. Josefina sells fruits and vegetables. She has a stall in the local market. 

She works every day from early in the morning when she receives her wholesale merchandise until seven o’clock in the evening when she returns home to rest. Her children help her on the weekends when she has more sales. 

She has spent more than 20 years in the business, as it is something that she loves to do and is how she earns an income for her and her children – as she acts as their mother and father at the same time. 

She is going to use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. She has done four cycles with the credit group and likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family of 2 children.

She has a dried fish business and  earns additional income raising pigs. Nenita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

Nenita has sustained her business through  3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to dry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a 43-year-old married woman with three children.

She has grown rice for 6 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elifazi

texts.en: Elifazi is a hardworking man with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda and needs a loan to buy cattle to sell. He sells cattle, milk, cheese, and butter. All these businesses have enabled him to provide for his family. He faces fluctuating prices and the ongoing prolonged drought. In spite of these, Elifazi wishes to educate his children and build a permanent building.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Arvelod

texts.en:
Arvelod is 25 years old from Tsalenjikha district. He has a large family with 10 members. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have four cows and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of vegetables to sell locally, and for family use as well. His father trades wood and generates some income. 

Arvelod decided to start his own business and increase the family income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 USD. With the received credit he will open a food market in Tsalenjikha district. The Start Up program will give him a chance to generate a stable income and help his family financially.

loans.use: to open a food market and generate stable income.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en: Mikheil, 25 years old, is married and lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter. Mikheil wants to start a sales business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1,800 US. Mikheil will use the received credit to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and will start selling. Mikheil will have a chance to generate his own income in order to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to begin selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store to sell noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. She is a 52-year-old married woman who  lives in Talibon. Bohol.

She has run a variety store for 10 years and  requests a loan to purchase assorted items for the store. She will be able to attract more consumers, increase  her income,  settle her obligations, and set aside savings for emergency uses.

Zenaida would like to expand her sari-sari(variety) store accommodate more consumers and become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase assorted items for the store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman who owns a transportation business and her husband is a carpenter. Jocelyn needs to increase her income because her children's needs are increasing. She says she is satisfied with her business income. 

She borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires for her motorcycle. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow..

loans.name: Lilia Ximena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lilia, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.
Doña Lilia realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico, el realiza diversos trabajos con ayuda de un operario a quien le paga por sui labor, él trabaja todos los días en su taller y también sale a donde lo requieran sus clientes, en su taller vende aceites, líquidos de frenos y muchos otros repuestos que emplea en su trabajo para lo cual el requiere del crédito. Su esposo lleva más de 10 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento de toda su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar herramientas, aceites y repuestos que el necesita en su taller. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudarle a su esposo en su trabajo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Luchando Por Un Sueño communal loan group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and as a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

Lilia lives in this place. She is 23 years old, in a common-law marriage and in this relationship has a son who is 5 years old and goes to school. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Lilia gets the loan to help her husband who has a auto shop. He does a variety of work with the help of an employee who he pays for his labor. He works every day in his shop and also goes out to where his customers need him. In his shop he sells oil, brake fluid, and many other spare parts that are used in his work, for which he needs the loan. Her husband has been working for more than 10 years in this job with which he earns the sustenance for the whole family.

This loan is to purchase tools, oil, and spare parts which are needed in his workshop. She has been in the communal bank group for 1 year and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to help her husband in his work. Her dream is to give her little one the best.

loans.use: to purchase tools, oil, and spare parts.

loans.name: Esperanza Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Esperanza, tiene 34 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 7 años que estudian en colegio y  en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una panadería.
Doña Esperanza es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle su marido con los gastos del hogar,  realiza este crédito para surtir una pequeña tienda en su casa y así ir de a poco generando ingresos para ir mejorando su calidad de vida. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su esposo para que él lo utilice en la panadería que tienen junto  a su familia en la cual todos tienen que invertir para salir adelante, el al igual que el resto de su familia trabajan en este lugar y reciben las ganancias por partes iguales con las cuales pueden llevar el sustento diario a sus familias. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir la tienda e ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella ayuda a su marido y ahora puede empezar su negocio propio. Sus sueños son que la tienda sea un éxito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Luchando Por Un Sueño communal loan group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and as a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

Esperanza lives in this place. She is 34 years old, is in a common-law marriage and in this relationship has two children, ages 16 and 7, who go to secondary and primary school. Her husband works in a bakery. 

Esperanza is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She takes out this loan to stock a small store in her house and in this way, generate a little income to improve her quality of life. She also gives part of the loan to her husband so that he uses it in the bakery that they have with his family in which all have to invest to get ahead. He, like the rest of his family, works in this place and they get the earnings in equal parts with which they can bring daily sustenance to their families. 

This loan is to purchase groceries to stock her store and ingredients to make bread. She has been in the communal loan group for 6 years and she likes it because in this way she helps her husband and now she can begin her own business. Her dreams are that her store is a success and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: María Sobeida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Tosagueñas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no  tiene hijos. El marido es panadero. 
Doña María y su esposo tienen una panadería en su casa, allí ellos elaboran pan de varios moldes y sabores así como también tortas, roscas y muchos productos más que son el deleite de sus clientes, ellos se levantan en la madrugada para tener listo todo para cuando lleguen sus clientes, ya que para ellos lo más importante es que su clientela este contenta con el servicio y el producto que reciben, llevan más de 15 años trabajando en esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente. Ella agradece  a la institución y a las personas que aportan para que ellos puedan recibir los créditos, ya que gracias a ellos pueden mejorar su vida y su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva 5 ciclos  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
Every 15 days in the city of Tosagua the Tosaguan Women's Credit Group meets. The location is known as a very dynamic one, where the majority of the inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and livestock-raising, since it is a great vegetation zone.

Maria lives here. She is 36 years old and is in a common-law union with no children. Her husband is a baker.

Maria and her husband operate a bakery in their house, making bread of various shapes and flavors, as well as sandwiches, buns, and many products that delight their customers. The two arise early in the morning to get everything ready for their customers arrival. For Maria and her husband it is most important that their clientele is content with the service and the products they receive. Maria and her husband have done this for over 15 years. And it has provided them with an honorable living. 

Maria is grateful to this institution and to the people who support them through these loans, making it possible to improve their business and their lives.

The present loan is for purchasing wheat flour, eggs, sugar and other ingredients for preparing bread. The credit group is in its 5th loan cycle and the members are grateful for the help we provide with the loans.

Their dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Mela

texts.en:
Mela is a 55-year-old widow with seven children. 

She has raised pigs for 2 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

She has previously borrowed 3 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamin.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 23 года, замужем, детей нет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Бактыгул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы. На земельном участке мерою 0,18 Га она выращивает экологически-чистый картофель, вся деятельность приносит прибыль в сумме до 30,000 сом (KGS) в квартал. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Baktygul is 23, married, and has no children. She raises livestock and plants crops as the main source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, Baktygul currently has two cows. She grows organic potatoes on a 0.18 hectare plot of land and earns up to 30,000 som (KGS) per quarter. Having concluded that her business is profitable, Baktygul applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy two cows for fattening. She plans to use her profits continue investing in her business and to finish building a house.

loans.use: to buy two cows for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has six children.  She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 15 years. She requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  liqueur, soft drinks, eggs, and canned goods.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 26 previous loans from NWTF. She earns an income from food vending.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy liqueur, soft drinks, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 44-year-old married woman with twelve children, five attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sylvia has had a fishing business for 2 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 60-year-old married woman with four children.

She has earned a living by raising pigs for 10 years. She requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  feed.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is a 21-year-old student who lives in the Kutaisi district. Her parents live abroad and send her money to cover everyday costs. Tamar wants to start her own business and generate her own income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 300 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase jewelry and will resell to students and neighbors.  She will be able to generate a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a variety of clothing to sell to be able to support her family more.

loans.name: Aracely María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en una cooperativa de trasporte.
Doña Aracely es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella junto  a su hermano arriendan un local en el centro de la ciudad donde tienen un comedor el cual comparten pero cada uno en diferentes horarios,  ella solo prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos que son del agrado de sus distinguida clientela que a diario se sirven en su local, mientras que su hermano en las noches vende pollo a la brasa.  Ella varia el menú para que sus clientes siempre tengan variedad en sus platos y estén a gusto con lo que ella prepara, lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo y contribuir con los gastos que genera el hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan la fundación y las personas que hacen posible que ella reciba su crédito.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Luchando Por Un Sueño communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and as a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

Aracely lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married and in this relationship has 2 children, ages 12 and 5, who are students in secondary school and primary school. Her husband works in a transportation cooperative.

Aracely is a woman who likes to earn her own money and with her income help her husband get ahead. Together, she and her brother rent a stall in the center of the city where they have a restaurant which they share but each one has a different schedule. She only prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches which are the joy of her distinguished customers who she serves daily in her stall, while her bother at night sells grilled chicken. She varies her menu so her customers always have a variety of dishes and are happy with what she prepares. She has been in this business for 3 years which allows her to earn something and contribute to the expenses that are generated by the household, and with raising her little ones. 

This loan will be used to purchase rice, meat, fish and other groceries to prepare the dishes. She has been in the commmealsunal bank group for 5 years and likes it for the help that the foundation gives her and the people who make it possible for her to get her loan. Her dream is to have a big restaurant and give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  a motorcycle to transport his agricultural produce to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to add more stock of timber for making furniture and constructing houses

loans.name: Gladys Modesta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Gladys realiza el crédito para su esposo el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra maíz, maní y verduras pero esto en la época invernal,  con su marido trabajan  tres personas a quienes les paga por su trabajo lo cual los convierte en fuente de ingresos para estas familias, actualmente están en la limpieza y abono de las plantas razón por lo cual están con urgencia de recibir el crédito ya que si no se le pone los fertilizantes la producción se puede dañar. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra de la limpieza de los cultivos. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Luchando Por Un Sueño communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and as a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

Gladys lives in this place. She is 60 years old, married, and in this relationship has 4 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer. 

Gladys takes out the loan for her husband who works in agriculture. He grows corn, peanuts and vegetables in the winter. Three people work with her husband and he pays them for their work, which becomes a source of income for these families. Currently they are in the cleaning stage and fertilizing the plants, for which reason she urgently needs to get the loan since if they don't apply the fertilizer, the crops can be damaged.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay labor costs for the cleaning of the crops. She has been in the communal bank group for 5 years. Her dream is to have a very good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: María Celeste

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con. Su esposo es comerciante y  agricultor.
Doña María realiza el crédito para ella y su esposo, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, maní y verduras en la época invernal,  pero ellos también juntos tienen un negocio de venta de productos de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceites, frutas legumbres, entre otros productos, tienen un puesto en  el mercado de la localidad en la cual los fines de semana venden estos productos, solo vende en estos días porque es cuando más gente llega al lugar y sus ventas son mejores, el resto de la semana él se dedica a sus cultivos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, legumbres y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Luchando Por Un Sueño communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and as a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

María lives in this place. She is 54 years old, married, and in this relationship has 3 adult children, one of whom still lives with them. Her husband is in trade and is a farmer.

María gets the loan for herself and her husband. He works in agriculture, growing corn, peanuts and vegetables in the winter, but they also together have a business selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, fruit, vegetables, and other products. They have a stall in the market of their locality in which they sell these products on the weekends. They only sell on those days because it is when more people come to the place and their sales are better. The rest of the week he works with his crops. 

This loan will be used to purchase groceries, vegetables, and fertilizers for the corps. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning. Her dreams are to have a very good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had supported her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her afford the educational expenses and daily needs of her children.

She is positive that she can improve her business with another loan of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at the store. An increase of sales will  increase her profit, which will hep her business to become viable and sustainable. She will also be able to meet the needs of her family.

Jovita is a rice distributor and operates a clothing items and other merchandise business. She dreams of expanding in order to give her family a good life. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Nataly

texts.es:
Maria Nataly tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. Cuenta con 02 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de cuyes, pavos, gallinas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Maria Nataly obtendrá una mayor producción, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Nataly is 28 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two children in the district of Oyotún, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in the district is calm. The population is principally dedicated to agriculture, business, and livestock.

She is dedicated to raising and selling farm animals, including hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. She has 2 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. 

The current loan will be to buy guinea pigs, turkeys, and hens, among others, to grow the supply in her business. With this, Maria Nataly will have a better production, with the goal of growing her business and satisfying the needs of her clients. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and, thus, will improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, turkeys, and hens, among others to grow the supply of her business.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila y su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivar maíz, frejol, yuca, rocoto, entre otros alimentos. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera le ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, con esto Sergio obtendrá una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción y una mejor calidad de producto lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is 28 years old. He is in a common-law married, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in the district is calm, and the population is dedicated mainly to agriculture, business, and raising animals.

He is dedicated to agriculture, specifically to growing coffee. He also grows corn, beans, yucca, and peppers, among other foods. He has 6 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. 

The current loan will be used for agricultural work, implementing and incorporating plant protection products, fertilizers, and workers for his harvest. This will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crop. With this, Sergio will have a timely harvest and, thus, will have better production and a better quality of product. This will have a positive impact on his level of sales and will earn him a better income that will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: with agricultural work, implementing and incorporating plant protection products, fertilizers, and workers for his harvest

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a vegetable business for 6 years.

She requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase different vegetables to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase different vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Maria Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Nida is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil and other spices for her candy making business.

Ma. Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil and other spices

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira, her husband and two children live in Saratak village in Shirak region. 

Naira's two children attend village school. While her husband works as a migrant worker in a neighbouring country to support their two children, Naira began a farming business. Currently she keeps two cows, sixteen chickens and cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes.

She's excited to be distributing her own products and now she’s even more passionate about enlarging her potato cultivation and making sales. The only thing Naira wants is the financial means to invest in the farm. She plans to purchase potatoes (650 kgs) and fertilizer. 

Unfortunately, a lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their businesses in Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low.

Naira's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved populations of Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

Naira hopes for lenders' support to earn a higher income so she can provide better living conditions to her beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for potatoes (650 kgs) and fertilizer to cultivate potatoes and sell them to earn income for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and materials for the repair of a fishing boat for her fishing business. Genelyn has been in this business for 2 years, and she earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and materials for the repair of a fishing boat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a married mother of three children, two of whom go to school, also takes care of additional family members. Sarah lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

For eight years, Sarah has been selling charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. Working seven days a week, her major business challenges include high transportation costs. She generates additional income from poultry farming. 

Sarah has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She aspires to expand her charcoal sales.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ernestina,  la socia  se dedica  a la  Ganadería  y producción de  lácteos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia produce  leche, queso y yogurt, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
She is Ernestina. She is dedicated to cattle and dairy production. She is a responsible and diligent person. She has spent years working on this business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it everyday. She produces milk, cheese, and yogurt. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She requests a loan to buy milk, among other things.

She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her to develop in her work, and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy milk, among other things.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
From Ozamiz City, Estela earns a living selling used clothing. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her enterprise. She is happy to have been able to beat the odds and achieve business success with determination; her family is her inspiration. 

To earn more, Estela has requested a loan to purchase more used clothing inventories to sell. She hopes to live comfortably as her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Los Parra Group

texts.es:
La producción de caña de azúcar es lo que da vida a la comunidad donde se formó el grupo “Los Parra”. Cada uno de los integrantes se dedica a una actividad económica para llevar el sustento a su familia: Efigenia y Jesús se dedican a la venta de fertilizantes; Teresa, a la cosecha de caña y elaboración de manualidades y José, a ofrecer su servicio como taxista.   

Doña Teresa recibió un pequeña parcela, regalo de sus padres, en la cual siembra caña empleando a 6 personas para limpiar, sembrar y cuidar de este fruto de la tierra. Durante 16 años esta ha sido su actividad principal en la cual su esposo también participa y juntos trabajan la parcela que será el patrimonio de sus hijas. 

Hace 2 meses Teresa y su esposo tomaron un taller de elaboración de manualidades como maceteros, botes de basura, bases para espejos y porta retratos con materiales reciclados, especialmente llantas usadas. Desde entonces la pareja dedica sus tardes a esta actividad. “Es una manera de pasar más tiempo juntos y obtener ingresos” comenta Tere emocionada ya que tan sólo dos meses después ya tienen clientes y sus figuras han llegado a otros estados del país. 

Para continuar con su actividad, Tere necesita comprar más material: en las vulcanizadoras y talleres de motos conseguirá las llantas viejas que normalmente desechan y también comprará más pintura de aceite y brochas. 

Doña Teresa se muestra agradecida por cada uno de los préstamos que ha recibido anteriormente ya que ha invertido en la siembra de caña y las ganancias le ayudaron a iniciar su nuevo negocio y seguir dando lo mejor a sus hijas. 

*En la imagen: doña Teresa muestra un porta espejo en forma de sol, y su hija uno en color azul.
texts.en:
Sugar cane production is what gives life to the community where the Los Parra group was formed. Each of the members works in an economic activity to bring sustenance to their families: Efigenia and Jesús sell fertilizers; Teresa harvests cane and makes crafts and José offers taxi service. 

Teresa got a small plot of land, a gift from her parents, on which she grows cane, employing 6 people to clean, sow and care for this fruit of the earth. For 16 years this has been her primary work, in which her husband also participates and together they work the plot that will be their daughters' inheritance.

Two months ago, Teresa and her husband took on a workshop making crafts such as flower pots, trash cans, mirror and photo frames out of recycled materials, especially used tires. Since then, her husband spends his afternoons in this work. "It is a way to pass more time together and get income," says Tere, excited since with only two months of work, they already have customers and their art has arrived in other states of the country. 

To continue with her work, Tere needs to purchase more material, in the vulcanizing shops and motorcycle shops, she will get the old tires that normally are thrown out and also will purchase more oil paint and brushes. 

Teresa is grateful for each one of the loans she has gotten previously since she has invested in planting cane and the earnings helped her to begin her new business and continue giving the best to her daughters. 

*In the image, Teresa is holding a mirror base in the shape of a sun, and her daughter holds a blue one.

loans.use: to purchase old tires, oil paint and brushes.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Las Bugambilias Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad  productora de caña de azúcar y de tradiciones mazatecas, se formó un grupo llamado “Las Bugambilias”. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta de: 

Saturnina,  Paula, Carmen – Refrescos 
María  Lourdes - Cosméticos Y Combustible
Cedonia – Servilletas 
Verónica – Calzado Por Catalogo 
Norma – Carne
Arturo – Pollo Y Pan 
María – Antojitos  Y Fertilizantes 
José,  Elia – Fertilizantes 
Inés – Tamales Y Chiles Réyenos 
Karina – Plásticos 
Eleucadia – Pollo 
Josefina, Matilde – Antojitos 
Martha – Carne De Cerdo 
Modesta – Mojarra 
Margarita –Dulces
 
Doña María de Lourdes, mejor conocida como Lulú, comenzó su actividad hace tres años, cuando todos sus hijos dejaron el hogar. Para evitar sentir el vacío y ocupar su mente en algo productivo solicitó su primer préstamo que invirtió en cosméticos. 

Dos años después, tras observar que no sólo ella sino otras personas en la comunidad se quedaban sin gasolina con frecuencia y que la distancia para la gasolinera más próxima no era muy alentadora, decidió comenzar a vender combustible. 

Hoy en día, Lulú conserva ambas actividades, con sus ganancias ha hecho remodelaciones a su vivienda, reinvierte en los negocios y también apoya a una de sus hijas y su nieta que regresaron a vivir con ella. Esta vez necesita un préstamo para comprar más labiales, sombras, delineadores, rímel, cremas y Diesel. A Lulú le gustaría poder criar puercos para vender en las comunidades vecinas para tener otro ingreso extra. 

Los miembros de “Las Bugambilias”, especialmente doña Lulú agradecen a cada una de las personas que han contribuido a sus préstamos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio al que pertenecen los integrantes. Doña Lulú es quien viste una blusa color morado y tiene en brazos a su nieta.
texts.en:
In a community which produces sugar cane and has Mazateca traditions, a group called Las Bugambilias was formed. The members of this group work in the sale of:

Saturnina,  Paula, Carmen – soft drinks 
María  Lourdes - cosmetics and gas
Cedonia – napkins 
Verónica – shoes from a catalog
Norma – meat
Arturo – chicken and bread 
María – snacks and fertilizer 
José,  Elia – fertilizer 
Inés – tamales and chilies rellenos
Karina – plastic goods 
Eleucadia – chicken 
Josefina, Matilde – snacks 
Martha – pork 
Modesta – mojarra fish
Margarita –sweets
 
María de Lourdes, better known as Lulú, began her work three years ago, when her children left the home. To avoid feeling the emptiness and to keep her mind on something productive, she asked for her first loan which she invested in cosmetics. 

Two years later, after observing that not only she but other people in the community are frequently left without gas and that the distance to the nearest gas station was not very encouraging, she decided to begin to sell gas. 

Today, Lulú has both jobs. With her earnings she has done remodeling to her house, she reinvests in both businesses and also supports one of her daughters and her granddaughter who came back to live with her. This time, she needs the loan to purchase more lipstick, eye shadow, eye liner, mascara, creams, and diesel. Lulú would like to be able to raise pigs to sell in the nearby communities to have extra income. 

The members of "Las Bugambilias", especially Lulú are grateful to each and every one of the people who have contributed to their loans. 

*The photo was taken in the municipal park where the members life. Lulú is wearing a purple shirt and has her granddaughter in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase more lipstick, eye shadow, eye liner, mascara, creams and diesel.

loans.name: Wilson Renan

texts.es: Wilson es un joven de 34 años de edad, tiene  una hija de 2 años, Wilson vive en la casa de su madre y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja vendiendo verduras con su madre, Wilson necesita el dinero del crédito para la comprar de pollos que los cria en un corral, Wilson aspira mejorar su negocio de crianza de pollos y su otra negocio para asi mejorar la calidad de vida juntamente con su hija y la madre de la niña.
texts.en: Wilson is a 34-year-old young man. He has a 2-year-old daughter. He lives in his mother's house and works raising small animals and also works selling vegetables with his mother. Wilson needs the money from the loan to purchase chickens which he raises in a corral. Wilson aspires to improve his business raising chickens and with his other business to be able to improve the quality of life with his daughter and the girl's mother.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia has mastered swine production in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living supporting her husband in raising their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as how she takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing she may need. This loan of 14,900 PHP will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine. Guia hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two attending school. 

She has been operating a food stall on retail at the market for the last 16 years, working 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000  from MCDT- SACCO to buy green bananas, tomatoes, onions, and fruit. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices of food. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. 

Margaret lives in her own house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, tomatoes, onions and fruit.

loans.name: Arinolta

texts.en:
Arinolta is a 51-year-old mother from Kakamega, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married to John and supports five people in her family that include her four children who are; 17, 15, 14 and 11 years old.

She runs a small scale retail shop where she operates a wet cell battery charging service. She has been operating it for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to add more stock of shop items. She will use the anticipated profits to open another retail shop so as to give her more income to support the family. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase another battery charger so as to be able to earn more income to support her family

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa, 39 years old, lives in Sebucao, Dumalinao, Philippines. She is married and gifted with three children. Andresa's husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Andresa has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband to plow the rice field and to plant corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Andresa decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 9,000 PHP to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. Andresa has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a a hardworking mother who is always out in the streets to sell her fish. She is a very diligent and determined fish vendor, and she works twice as hard so she can sustain her needs. She is from Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Jessica has applied for her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Jessica is in need of capital to purchase more fish to sell. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 20,000 PHP, and she is thankful to them for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to manage it well for her loyal customers. Jessica deeply wishes that someday she can own a space where she can display her fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres sells retail goods such as detergent and has been in this business for six years now. She is 59 years old, is widowed and has six children. Right now her monthly income is 10,000 KES. She will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as tissue paper, detergents for cleaning the toilets and bottled water. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hope is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods such as tissue paper, detergents for cleaning the toilets and bottled water.

loans.name: Almash

texts.ru: Алмаш 32 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Алмаш имеет среднее образование, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, она начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Алмаш приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. На собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,46 ГА она выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмаш обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы и 3 овец. В будущем, Алмаш планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность.
texts.en: Almash is 32, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education and began raising livestock and planting crops to earn additional income for her family. She started her business with 20,000 som (KGS). Almash has made every effort to expand her business and currently has four cows. She grows potatoes both for use on the farm and to sell on her own 0.46 hectare plot of land. In order to continue developing her business, Almash applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow and three sheep. In the future, Almash plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and three sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La sonrisa de María Auxiliadora, no es más que un reflejo de la felicidad que siente al ver su negocio crecer. Vestida bajo un delantal y adornada con su vegetales para su cocina, le recuerdan lo agradecida que está con todos los que la apoyaron con el préstamo anterior para comprar arroz, plátanos, aceite, pollo crudo, queso, entre otros que servirían para tener más ganancias y le permitieron mejorar su hogar. 
Ahora esta mujer de sesenta y dos años de edad, se siente como una niña en el parque, cuando ella está realizando su trabajo. Por lo que no duda en invertir de nuevo en su negocio, esta vez para comprar arroz, azúcar, plátano, aceite, pollo crudo, entre otros materiales de la cocina. Además desea comprar manteles para cubrir las mesas de sus clientes y así proyectar mejor la imagen de su negocio de comida. Al cancelar el crédito considera que es necesario invertir de nuevo en el negocio para que se mantuviera.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora's smile is no more than a reflection of the happiness she feels seeing her business grow. Dressed in an apron and surrounded by her vegetables for her cooking, they remind her how grateful she is to everyone who supported her with the previous loan to buy rice, bananas, oil, raw chicken, and cheese, among other items that will help her to have more income and will allow her to improve her home.

Now this 62-year-old woman feels like a child in the park when she is doing her work, so she does not hesitate to invest again in her business, this time to buy rice, sugar, bananas, oil, and raw chicken, among other cooking materials. She also wants to buy tablecloths to cover her customers' tables and better project the image of her food business. Having paid off the loan, she thinks it is necessary to invest again in the business so that it may continue.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bananas, oil, raw chicken, and tablecloths for the table, among other items

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Los años pasan y María sigue siendo reconocida por la venta de ropa. Ya con 21 años como comerciante de ropa, esta mujer de sesenta años de edad sabe que su negocio ha sido un éxito. Ella se siente muy agradecida por esto, puesto que sin el apoyo de MiCrédito, Kiva y todas las personas que le apoyaron para obtener ese crédito que la ayudó a comprar cosméticos, camisas, pantalones, entre otras mercaderías que le ayudó a crecer económica y personalmente. 
Tras ver el impacto del préstamo anterior, María solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar pantalones, ropa interior, camisetas, entre otros productos de mayor demanda en sus ventas. Esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad y por supuesto, incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. Al cancelar este préstamo, considera comprar más ropa nueva que le permita extender más su negocio.
texts.en:
The years go by and María continues to be well-known for selling clothing. With 21 years as a clothing merchant, this sixty-year-old woman knows that her business has been a success. She feels very grateful for this, since the support of MiCrédito, Kiva, and all the people who supported her to get that loan that helped her to buy cosmetics, shirts, and pants, among other merchandise, helped her to grow economically and personally.

After seeing the impact of the previous loan, María is asking for a new loan in order to buy pants, underwear, and shirts, among other products that are in great demand at her sales. This will allow her to offer more variety and, of course, will increase her sales and income. Upon paying off this loan, she is considering buying more new clothing that will allow her to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy pants, underwear, and shirts, among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Emprendedoras está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una lucha para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalba, quien está trabajando y luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere mejorar sus ingresos e ir creciendo por medio de las capacitaciones que ira recibiendo. Rosalba tiene una peluquería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano empezando sus ventas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Las Emprendedoras” (The Enterprising Ones) is taking the poverty elimination survey so that all of the members can strive to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Sra. Rosalba, who is working and striving to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She is a self-sacrificing woman who wants to improve her earnings and grow as a result of the training she has received. Rosalba has a beauty salon where she works every day, starting early in the morning so that she can begin making sales.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL.
La socia  es la señora María Cleofe, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the bank San Bartolome de Tambo Real [St. Bartholomew of Tambo Real].

This borrower is name María Cleofe, and she alternates her daily activities with her livestock business. She has been in this business for quite a while, and it is going very well thanks to the determination with which she works every day. She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business, and she commits to paying back her installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 29-yearsold married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income which barely cover all the family's needs. 

Wafa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity. 

Wafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Gertrude has a pub and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda and jerrycans of local gin. She generates additional income through selling piped water. She works at the market seven days week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges includes defaulters and high taxes imposed on local brew.

She aspires to see her children go up to the university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major challenges include school fees.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la  agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is named Aleja and belongs to the “San Bartolome de Tambo Real” communal bank.

She continues working in agriculture and livestock breeding. She is a responsible and diligent person.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business, and she commits to paying back her installments on time.

She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she provides for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. Aside from that, she also engages in producing crab traps made of bamboo. She makes and sells crab traps to the locals in her place. She is a 60-year-old woman with five grown children. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 10 years.  

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for the laborers and for bamboo materials. These will improve the yield of her farm and augment her daily income. In this way, she could now purchase more materials to produce more crab traps to be sold. 

Paulina dreams to become successful in handling both sources of income to be more productive in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for the laborers, and for bamboo materials

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is 58 years old and a widow but is blessed with 3 children. She has farmed for the last 12 years, earning KES 20,000 per month.

This is her third loan from Vision Fund Kenya, a request of KES 12,000 to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. She desires to increase her income by using the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land and build her own rental houses.

Claris hopes and dreams to have rental houses and well-educated children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and widowed. With her two children, she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over ten years, she has owned and operated a business buying and selling goods, earning 5,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2007. Now, she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional goods to sell in her store. With the profits, Teresita will make improvements to her house to raise the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a mother from Molave who never gets tired of supporting her family and helping her husband earn an income.

Rosemarie has skills and expertise in cake baking, yet she had not enough capital to make it into a business. She joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start her business, which is cake baking. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her cakes.

Rosemarie has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking equipment for her business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family.

Today, other retail businesses sell her product, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking equipment for her cake business.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 55 years old and married. He lives in Molave.

Junie runs an auto-shop, offering services like tire vulcanizing, rim alignment and battery charging. This is his way of earning a living to raise his family. He has had this business for 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. Junie has requested a loan for purchasing additional materials, equipment and other accessories for his shop to improve services. Junie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

In the future, Junie hopes to own a bigger, comfortable space where he can relocate his shop to expand his business operations.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, equipment and other accessories for his auto-shop to improve services.

loans.name: Alegandro

texts.es:
La niñez de Alejandro fue basada de las siembras de maíz, frijoles y trigo. En lugar de sus estudios, este agricultor de 47 años de edad, siguió la tradición de sus abuelos y de su padre, dándole paso al trabajo y dejando sus libros atrás. No fue hasta los 25 años que decidió independizarse, obteniendo terrenos por partes pequeñas para crear su propia cosecha junto a su esposa e hijos. 
Afortunadamente este hombre luchador cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, de su yerno y de sus dos hermanos. Además no desaprovechar la oportunidad de viajar a Costa Rica en las temporadas bajas para seguir trabajando. Sus expectativas son de calidad, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar semilla del frijol y abono para cumplir con esto. Esto le permitirá seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente. En sus planes está comprar dos terneros para ingresar en el mundo de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Alejandro's childhood was based on crops of corn, beans, and wheat. This 47-year-old farmer followed the tradition of his grandparents and his father instead of his studies, yielding to work and leaving his books behind. It was not until 25 years ago that he decided to become independent, obtaining land in small pieces in order to create his own harvest with his wife and children.

Fortunately this fighter of a man has the support of his children, his son-in-law, and his two brothers. In addition, he does not miss the opportunity to travel to Costa Rica in the off-season in order to continue working. He expects quality, so he is asking for a loan to buy bean seeds and manure to achieve this. This will allow him to continue growing personally and professionally. His future plan is to buy two calves in order to enter the world of ranching.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and manure

loans.name: Sysco

texts.en:
Sysco is a persistent and hardworking woman who takes advantage of her farming skills to generate an income. She is a hardworking mom and aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips. She is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says. 

Sysco has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. She is seeking a loan to buy land and expand her horticulture farm. 

She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Sysco. 

Through a group of 15 members called Rot Gaa self-help group, Sysco has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Sysco, because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To buy land and expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: José Fabian

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Luchando Por Un Sueño, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva dos años en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta la institución por la ayuda que les brindan a personas como él para poder sacar sus actividades comerciales adelante.
Don José para ganarse la vida y para ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos se dedica a realizar fletes en su moto taxi, en este lugar ese es el medio de transporte más utilizado por las personas para transportarse a diferentes lugares, el trabaja todos los días aunque los fines de semanas son los días que mejores ganancias le dejan,  lleva más de 6 años ofreciendo este servicio lo cual le ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito lo espera utilizar para realizar arreglos a su moto taxi para brindar un mejor servicio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia para cuando le toque formar su hogar.
texts.en:
The members of the Luchando Por Un Sueño (Fighting for a Dream) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents make a living through agriculture and raising animals, and for being an area of lush vegetation.

This is where José lives. He is 23 years old, is single, and lives at his parents' home. 

He has been a member of the communal bank for the past two years, and he likes the Institution because of the help they give to people like him, so they can make their businesses thrive.

In order to make a living and help out his parents, whose financial resources are very limited, he transports goods in his motorcycle taxi. In this area, this is the means of transport that most people use to travel from one place to another. 

He works every day; however, weekends are the days when he makes better profits. For over six years, he has been providing this service, which has allowed him to get ahead.

He plans to use this loan to do some repairs to his motorcycle taxi in order to provide a better service.

He dreams of having his own home by the time he starts raising a family of his own.

loans.use: to do some repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Las líneas que se dibujan en las hortalizas de chile y maíz que cultiva Salomón, son una marca de su tan apasionado trabajo como agricultor desde hace más de cuarenta años. Este hombre de 54 años de edad, trabaja desde pequeño, puesto que creció con el sonido de las vacas y las gallinas. A los 25 años trabajo para alguien como agricultor, labor que le inspiró a emprender por cuenta propia, trabajo digno que ha servido para salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ahora todos los años Salomón es reconocido por la calidad de su cultivo, por lo que en esta nueva temporada piensa invertir económicamente en su cosecha. Razón por la cual solicita un crédito para comprar abono, semillas y pagar arado para sembrar correctamente. Esto le permitirá seguir cultivando de forma efectiva para seguir incrementando sus ventas y por supuesto sus ingresos. En sus metas está comprar dos vacas para incursionar en el mundo de la ganadería.
texts.en:
The lines drawn in the corn and chilli crops that Salomon grows are a mark of his passionate work as a farmer for over forty years. The 54-year-old Salomon has been working since he was small, having grown up with the sound of cows and chickens. At the age of 25 he was employed as a farmer, and this experience inspired him to start up on his own. This respectable work has allowed his family to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Now, every year Salomon is known for the quality of his crop, so this season he plans to invest in his harvest. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for a plow to plant correctly. This will allow him to continue farming effectively to further increase his sales and of course his income. One of his goals is to buy two cows to venture into the world of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and to pay for a plow.

loans.name: Edgar Benjamin

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre de cuarenta y un años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre doce años y seis meses, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Edgar para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace diez años, pero Edgar para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la albañilería él cuenta que esta segunda actividad le  ayudado de manera grande con los ingresos.
Edgar ahora ha pensado en cultivar en  esta nueva temporada, pero para poder hacerlo deberá pagar el alquiler del terreno donde el cultiva, y comprar su abono químico, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el  capital suficiente para poder pagar el alquiler del terreno y comprar su abono químico.
El gran sueño de Edgar es poder cultivar este año para mejorar sus ingresos y poder comprar un terreno donde pueda cultivar, para seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 41-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of two children who are 12 years and 6 months old. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

To make money and support his family, Edgar has grown corn and beans for a living for the past 10 years. But to improve his income, Edgar also works in construction. He says that the income from this second job has been extremely helpful to him.

Edgar has thought about farming during this new season, but to be able to do it, he needs to pay the rent on the land where he grows and buy his chemical fertilizer. But one of the difficulties he has is that he doesn't have enough capital to pay the land rent and buy his chemical fertilizer.

Edgar's greatest dream is to be able to farm this year to increase his income and be able to buy a piece of land where he can grow crops, so he can continue helping his children in school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay land rent

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Las 17 integrantes del comité realizan trabajos a fin de poder ir mejorando cada día.
Florentina se dedica a la venta de frazadas y ropas variadas, y por medio de su trabajo lucha para tener los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, es la presidenta de este grupo y siempre lucha para poder dar el ejemplo a sus demás compañeras.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas variadas para la venta, y con ello poder seguir luchando para mejorar cada día
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of Caacupé. There are 17 members of this committee and they are working together so that they can improve each day.

Florentina sells blankets and various types of clothes. Through her work, she is striving to earn the income she needs to help her family. Florentina is a hardworking and determined individual. She is the president of this group and is trying to set an example for the other members.

Florentina is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes to sell. This will help her to continue improving each day.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa es una mujer de 45 años de edad soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 4 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 10 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de jugos naturales.
Ella es buena madre, sensible, sincera, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en zona ‘Tilata’ un área urbanizada residencial situada en el altiplano a una altura de 4100 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0 – 12 grados centígrados.
Jesusa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; las 2 hijas mayores estudian en la escuela, el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar y vive con su abuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica, alcantarillado y agua potable. Su negocio es la venta de jugos de frutas naturales, como licuados; de plátano, de manzana, de kiwi, de frutilla, de papaya y otras frutas todas con o sin leche. Y otros jugos tradicionales como el ‘batido’ que es un licuado de clara de huevo con azúcar y cerveza negra, muy popular por sus cualidades reconstituyentes, también vende zumo de zanahorias. Actividad que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta al aire libre de lunes a sábado en horas del día. “desde muy joven trabajé en la explotación de estuco, hace 3 años me independicé con el negocio de licuados y trabajo sola…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no tiene competencia en el lugar, la desventaja son las grandes distancias que debe recorrer caminando cargada de todas sus frutas hasta su puesto de venta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio con nuevas máquinas y utensilios de cocina, ella desea realizar la compra de una sumidora y licuadora porque las que tiene ya están desgastadas y no funcionan de manera correcta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Jesusa solicita un prestamo para la compra de una sumidora y una licuadora para trabajar en su negocio y alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a 45 year-old single mother.  She has a 4 year-old son, and two daughters aged 10 and 7.  She has a business selling natural juices.  She is a good mother who is sensitive, sincere, understanding, patient, a good listener, responsible, and very hardworking.  She is developing her business in the "Tilata" area, an urban residential area located on the high plateau at 4,100 meters above sea level.  This place has a cold and dry climate with a daytime temperature that varies between 1 and 12 centigrade.  

Jesusa has a dark complexion, long black hair that she wears pulled back, dark eyes, a short stature, and robust physique.  She dresses traditionally (wearing a hat, a shawl and a skirt).  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks in her hometown.  She also speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business.  She shares her life with her children.  Her two oldest daughters attend school, and the youngest is not yet school-aged and lives with his grandmother.   They live in their own home built of bricks and cement, with a tin roof.  The house has electricity, is connected to a sewer system, and has clean drinking water.  

Jesusa has a business selling natural juice beverages such as blended drinks made of banana, apple, kiwi, strawberries, papaya, and other fruits, made with or without milk.  She also makes traditional juices such as the "batido," which is a blended drink made from egg whites with sugar and dark beer.  This is very popular because of its restorative qualities.  She also sells carrot juice.  She operates her business from an outdoor stand during the daytime hours from Monday through Saturday.

 "Ever since I was very young I worked applying stucco.  Three years ago I started working independently with my juice business, and I work alone,"  she comments.  The advantage of her business is that there is no competition in the area.  The disadvantage is that she must travel by foot long distances, carrying all of the fruit to her sales post.
