Her dream is to expand her business with new machines and cooking utensils.  She wants to buy a strainer and blender because the ones she has are worn and don't work properly.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been operating her own business.  This is why Jesusa is requesting a loan to buy a strainer and a blender so that she can work in her business and feed her children.

loans.use: to buy a strainer and a blender for her business

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. fanny ella es soltera y tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de farmacia, la socia vende medicamentos, la socia trabaja en su farmacia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de farmacia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos para la farmacia.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de farmacia, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Qorichuspa” communal bank located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  

The member, Fanny, is 41, single, and has two children.  She works in her pharmacy business, selling medicine from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  She wishes to succeed through this business, and it’s going very well.  Her dream is to expand her pharmacy business, and she is requesting the loan to purchase medicine for the pharmacy.

The other members are engaged in pharmacy, clothing sales, grocery store, and bookshop businesses.  The partner is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium, and promises to make the payments according to the terms established.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas De Nazaret Group

texts.es: La Sra. Jesusa de 33 años de edad, es conviviente con el Sr. Roberto quien se dedica al servicio de taxi y con quien tiene 1 hijo que aun depende de ellos. Jesusa es Presidenta de la alcancía comunal “MUJERES EXITOSAS DE NAZARET” conformada por 6 mujeres que vienen trabajando responsablemente con nosotros hace 4 meses. Tiene como negocio la venta de productos de belleza y es consultora de la marca “Avon”, así de esta manera ayuda a su pareja en cubrir los gastos de la casa y brindar mejor calidad de vida para su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos  para su negocio que sigue creciendo. En la foto del grupo Jesusa se encuentra de pie junto a las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en:
Sra. Jesusa is 33 years old and in a common-law relationship with Sr. Roberto, who provides taxi services. They have one child who is dependent on them.

Jesusa is the president of the Communal Bank named “Mujeres Exitosas de Nazaret” (Successful Women of Nazareth). This group consists of six women who have been working responsibly with EDAPROSPO for the past four months. Jesusa has a business of selling beauty products and works as a consultant for the Avon brand. Working in this manner enables her to help her partner with the household expenses and providing a better quality of life for their family.

Jesusa’s loan will be invested in the purchase of products for her business so that she can keep growing. In the group photo, Jesusa is the one who is standing among the other women who are seated.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a single mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and dried fish. She works seven days a week, and her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She aspires to buy a plot of land to farm and to supplement her income. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and dried fish.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 49 year old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in the food vending business for more than five years now. She sells home cooked foods in her small eatery.

Veronica is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients for food to sell like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil and condiments, and others. Veronica believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food to sell like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil and condiments, and others.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 57-year-old married man and a father of five grown-up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. He runs a small sari-sari (retail) store business, selling various goods and items to the people in his place. 

Renato has been in the business for several years now. As of this time, he would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, rice and other items. A loan will help him improve his business, to make it a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, rice, and other items

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is a 26-year-old motorcycle operator in Voi, Kenya. He is married and a father of three children. Sebastian has been in the transport business for the last four years with a good income.

This marks his second time borrowing with VisionFund Kenya after repaying his first loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle transport and pay fees for his children, and use the anticipated profit to repay his loan. 

Sebastian hopes to own several motorcycles and employ more youth from his area in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Sherbeth

texts.en:
Sherbeth is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte.  

Sherbeth has been earning a living through hog raising business for more than a year now.  Sherbet is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Mabrouk

texts.en:
Mabrouk is single and 26 years old. Last year, he graduated from secondary school and anticipates his upcoming marriage.

Because he needs financial support and can't rely on his family, Mabrouk applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to purchase furniture for his house. In truth, his house needs a lot of furniture, and this loan will help him to purchase some of what is necessary to make he and his bride comfortable. He hopes to surprise his wife with a bedroom set, which allow Mabrouk to look after other expenses that he must address before he can marry.

In the future, Mabrouk looks forward to starting his own business that will guarantee a better future for him and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hard-working man who started the business of hardware in order to raise income to support his family. 

He has hopes of growing his business so as to satisfy the growing demands of his customers despite the difficulty of high rental fees. He is seeking for credit to buy more charcoal stoves and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal stoves and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 42 years old, married to Grace, and blessed with eight children. He has been a dairy farmer for the last ten years and the business earns him KES 16,000 per month. 

Thomas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable him expand his dairy farming for more income. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes are to be financially stable and occupy a larger niche in the market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him expand his dairy farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Saturnina ella es soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia vende la comida en el mercado,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Urubamba”. This bank is located in the District of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Saturnina. She is 54 years old, single, and has one child. She works at her business of selling food. Saturnina prepares different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and beef stir fry. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Saturnina sells her food at the market. She has been in business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members have businesses that involve selling food, clothes, groceries, and animals.

Saturnina appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the rice stock and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es de la ciudad de Encarnación, actualmente está cursando la carrera de Ingeniería civil, está en el 4to. año de la carrera, trabaja con sus padre en la construcción de obra en forma conjunta.
Su principal sueños es terminar su carrera y trabajar en forma independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder abrirse camino para poder alcanzar sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Nelson is from the city of Encarnación. He is currently in his fourth year of study toward a degree in Civil Engineering. He also works with his father in the construction sector. His main dreams are to finish his degree and to work independently.

Nelson is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. This will open the way for him to reach his goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Rowena has engaged in hog raising business for more than 20 years now.  This is the source of her income. 

Rowena is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Caloocan City, Philippines. She is 40 years old and has a child who is currently in school. She and Froilan, her husband, manage a fruit and meat stand business and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures. 

Arlene buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells mangoes, apples, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

Arlene is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit and meat products to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

In the future, Arlene hopes to find new customers and increase sales. She also dreams that her child will be able to finish their studies. Arlene meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional meat products and fruit staples she needs to increase her product inventory and provide more for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to take to the city to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, opta por un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de dos cerdos y reparar la motosierra con que prepara la madera para comercializarla, de esa manera su negocio mantendrá la continuidad.
Con el capital anterior pudo realizar los trabajos agrícolas de la temporada, su cosecha fue abundante, cuenta con alimento suficiente para su familia y ha mejorado la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Concepción chose to apply for a new loan to purchase pigs, and repair the power saw with which he prepares wood for sale.  In this way, his business will maintain continuity. The previous loan enabled him to carry out the season’s farm work.  His harvest was abundant, so he has enough food for his family, and has improved his business’s profitability

loans.use: to purchase pigs, and repair the power saw with which she prepares wood for sale.  In this way, her business will maintain continuity.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. Together, they reside in a rented house and have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Grace earns income from a beauty salon that she has operated for 7 years. Her business requires her to work seven days a week, but she faces challenges, including power outages. In addition to her services, she sells products on a retail basis.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, hair treatments, weaves, and braids to increase her income. In the future, Grace hopes to own a bridal salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo proviene de una familia muy unida, que se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante. Actualmente trabaja como fumigador de una empresa con la cual costea sus gastos de estudio. Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que algún día quiere poder independizarse y trabajar en su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera con lo cual podrá seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aldo comes from a very close-knit family in which everyone supports each other so that they can get ahead. He currently works as an exterminator for a company so that he can cover his educational expenses.

Aldo is studying for a degree in Accounting. He says that he wants to become independent someday and work in his chosen profession. Aldo is requesting a loan in order to pay his degree fees so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, el socio continua  dedicándose a la Ganadería a la venta de leche de vaca, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de una ternera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. He continues to manage his business of raising livestock and selling milk. The borrower has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day into his work. He wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy a calf. He is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms. By working in this manner, he will be able to help his family move forward.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a la  producción y venta de lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the communal bank,“San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She divides her time between her daily activities and producing and selling dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working in this way, in order to continue supporting her family.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of milk, among other items. 

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk, among other items.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Teresita earns a living through hog raising business. Teresita has been in the business for more than ten years now. 

As of this time, she would like to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Teresita believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en:
Amorlita started a small business and has become a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to maintain her inventories and reinvest her capital to gain more profit. Since she is the only store in the area, she makes good sales every day.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita hails from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. Two of them are still attending school. She engages in fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her place.  Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She is a 53-year-old  married woman, and has been engaged in that kind of business for 15 years now.   

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and stocks for the store like canned goods. These will help improve her ongoing catch and fill her store with more stock. She could now manage her finances and settle her obligations. Carmelita hopes that her existing business will prosper for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and stocks for the store like canned goods

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly, 40, is a fruit vendor from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has nine children. 

Sherly has been in the fruit vending business for more than 15 years now. This is her source of income. Sherly is asking to take a loan to buy more fruits to sell like banana. Sherly believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Sherly hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like bananas

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Theresia is in the farming business which she has done for the last twelve years. 

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,650 which she will be using to purchase solar equipment and bulbs. Her children have been struggling to do their homework in the dark and so this will provide a conducive environment for them to study. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar equipment and bulbs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old. She is a widow blessed with five children aged between 30-15 years old.  She has been in the farming business for 35 years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has borrowed KES 20,000 as her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, add seedlings, and pay school fees for her children.  She hopes the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her kids, cater for family medical care, pay for transportation of her farm products to the market and repay his loan too. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well expanded farming business, secure more market for her farm products, and live a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, add seedlings, and pay school fees for her kid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce like beans to sell.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benecia ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,aceite, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Apu Curi” communal bank located in Urcos, and belonging to the Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco.  

The member, Benecia, 34, is in a common-law relationship and has three children.  She has a restaurant where she prepares various dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and beef stir-fries, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Benecia is a hardworking, enterprising woman, and through the means of this small business, she is getting her children ahead.  She already has ten years in this business, and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase products for cooking such as chicken, oil, meat, and vegetables.

Benecia’s photo is attached to the group photo because she asked permission to have it taken after the meeting as she had to work.  

The other members are engaged in selling pigs, and some have animal sales, grocery store, and restaurant businesses.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking such as chicken, oil, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle raises and sells hogs. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 24-year-old woman with a dependent who is under one year old. She also grows rice. To support her business, she decided to take a loan.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticide, pig feed, and an additional piglet. These items will help her attain a higher yield. In the coming months, she will be able to raise healthy pigs. These will augment her income and improve her finances.

Michelle hopes that she can manage her business properly to become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticide, pig feed, and an additional piglet

loans.name: Sai Group

texts.en:
For the development of the household, some extra income is needed. So one of the women from Rental Basti located in Bhubaneswar, Khurda, Odisha, India, and some self dependent women of the same area stepped out and decided to build a secure life for future and their families with their contributions. They formed a group named “Sai” to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business and for development of their social life. 

Mrs. Kuna is the leader of the group who is sitting in front of their group in the photo. She has about 40 years old and lives with her husband, son, and two daughters. Mrs. Kuna herself has engaged in tthe tailoring activity for the last eight years. Now she has only one tailor machine for the tailoring occupation. Her husband also is helping her with  necessary tailor work related tasks. 

From her occupation the total earning capacity is INR 6,500 per month, but that is not sufficient to maintain her family. With this limited earning capacity they cannot maintain social livelihood. 

So she planned to borrow a loan from Mahashakti Foundation, which can help her to develop herself and her family members as well as maintain a good social livelihood. After the disbursement of the loan, she will purchase more stock on tailor-work related items and another tailor machine which will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the materials. 

Mrs. Kuna wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete the construction of her half-constructed house. The other three members of the group are also engaged with a different dairy, vegetable, and beetle shop, respectively, and they also can improve after loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase a new advanced swing machine

loans.name: Luz Adiela

texts.es:
Luz Aleida es una mujer de 49 años de edad se dedica a realizar artesanías, una actividad que adopto por necesidad económica pues se separó de su esposo y quedo como madre cabeza de familia, tiene dos hijas de 15 y 13 años de edad y su afán es poder tener un negocio sostenible para darles una buena calidad de vida.

Aprendido de la actividad gracias a un vecino y desde entonces trabaja 8 horas diarias.
Luz Aleida tiene un lindo deseo para este año que involucra su negocio, quiere darle a su hija mayor una enorme sorpresa, por problemas económicos no pudo realizarle la fiesta de 15 años la fecha que era, pero está a tiempo, y programo a escondidas de ella junto con su familia realizarle este acto tan importante para una adolescente que es su fiesta de 15 años, por ello está dispuesta a trabajar 14 horas diarias para generar mejores ingresos. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar sus artesanías los cuales son: acetato, pinceles, pinturas y cajas en acrílico.
Apoya a esta empresaria que quiere brindarle a su hija una enorme sorpresa que jamás en la vida olvidara.
texts.en:
Luz Aleida is 49 years old and makes crafts, an activity she took up out of financial necessity, as she separated from her husband and was left a single mother. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 13 and her wish is to have a sustainable business so that she can provide them with good quality of life. She learned this activity thanks to neighbor and since then has worked eight hours a day. 

Luz Aleida has a lovely wish for this year that involves her business. She wants to give her elder daughter a huge surprise. For financial reasons, she was not able to hold a 15th birthday celebration for her on the day of her birthday. But there is still time, and she and her family have secretly planned a celebration for this event, so important for a teenager, her 15th birthday. For this she is prepared to work 14 hours a day to generate more income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make her crafts: acetate, paint brushes, paint, and acrylic boxes. Please support this businessperson who wants to provide her daughter with a huge surprise that she will never in her life forget.

loans.use: To buy material such as acetate, paint brushes, paint, and acrylic boxes.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis enrique es un hombre de veintiocho años de edad, está casado y tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre dos y nueve años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Luis enrique para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace ocho años, él cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Para Luis Enrique no hay nada más importante que la comodidad de su amada familia, es por ello que desde hace algún tiempo decidió construir su casa, Luis Enrique a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos  no ha logrado terminar la construcción de su casa por lo que ahora solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, arena, hierro y block, para terminar su casa.
El gran anhelo de Luis Enrique es poder mejorar su casa, para que su familia tenga un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is twenty-eight years old.  He’s married and he has a beautiful family, with three children between the ages of two and nine.  They live in a community in Sololá.

Luis Enrique has worked in construction for eight years, in order to generate his income and support his family, and he says that thanks to this occupation, he has been able to provide for his children.

There is nothing more important to Luis Enrique than the comfort of his beloved family, and that is why some time ago, he decided to build his house.  But in spite of all his efforts, he has not been able to finish the construction, which is why he is currently requesting a loan.  He will use it to purchase cement, sand, iron, and blocks, in order to finish his house.

Luis Enrique’s biggest desire is to be able to improve his house so that his family may have a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, and blocks in order to finish his house.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is single and has two children who attend school. She is also looking after two nieces. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She has sold charcoal at the retail market for 10 years, working seven days a week. She earns additional income selling Irish potatoes. Justine is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for UGX 500,000 to buy bags of charcoal. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to accumulate enough profits to build her own premises. She lives in a rented house with no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tank Bovu Group

texts.en:
Editha, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children. One of them is still in school and the other one is still small.  She has been running a genge duka for 10 years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Editha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to open a duka and increase the genge stock.  She has managed to pay back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her gengeduka stock and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Editha will share this loan with her loan group, "Tank Bovu," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her genge duka stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 62 years old and he has one child. He's had a hotel business for four years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help generate enough food. His hopes and dreams for the future are to produce enough food to sell, grow the hotel and meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a tobacco seller from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has a two-year-old child. 

Sheila has been in business for more than three years now. Sheila is asking to take a loan to buy more tobacco to sell. A loan will help Sheila in improving her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an adorable, affectionate, striving, and hard-working mother who is the bread winner of her family. She is from Nandihills, a remote village in the famous Rift valley. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved, knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children. Nancy hopes to make progress as a poultry farmer and have a more stable income.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through a hog-raising business. Veronica has been in the business for more than three years now. Veronica is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and for animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. Moreover, she wants to expand her business in the future and make it a success. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a 30-year-old married woman and has five children, four of whom attend school in Kasese, Uganda. Lillian has been operating a motor vehicle spare parts shop for the last seven years in order to look after her children. Lillian has rentals as an additional source of income. She works very hard towards expanding her business and wants her children to go the best schools. However, she is faced with the challenge of market competition. Lillian is applying for a loan to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Elena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elena, se encuentra soltera, vive en casa familiar con sus padres, hermanos y sobrinos, se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de fotografía y filmación, el oficio lo aprendió cuando por necesidad de cubrir sus gastos personales busco empleo en una foto estudio, hace ya 13 años, sigue siendo empleada y en su tiempo libre realiza dicha actividad para obtener ingresos extras.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar papel fotográfico, memorias, tintas y otros materiales necesarios para desarrollar su trabajo, al contar con los accesorios indicados para trabajar dará a sus clientes un mejor servicio y finalizara los trabajos que en este momento ya tiene en proceso.
Sus sueños son tener los recursos económicos necesarios para fundar su propio negocio con un equipo de trabajo moderno.
texts.en:
Elena is single and lives in the family home with her parents, siblings, nieces and nephews. She provides a photography and videography service, an occupation she learned, when because of the need to cover her personal expenses, she found work in a photo studio, 13 years ago now. 

She is still employed there, and in her free time does this work to earn extra income. 

She will use the loan in order to buy photographic paper, computer memory, inks and other materials necessary to carry on her work. Having the above-noted work supplies, she will provide her customers with better service and will complete the jobs which she already has in process at this time. 

Her dream is to have the necessary financial resources to start her own business, with modern work equipment.

loans.use: To buy photographic paper, computer memory, inks and other materials necessary for carrying out her work.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
This woman is 45 years old and she lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Gohar lives with her husband and her son. All her family is busy with farming and agriculture, but the main part of the work is her responsibility since her husband also seasonally goes abroad to work in the Russian Federation. Gohar’s son does different construction work in their village, so he is very often busy with his work. Since he comes home very late, he does not manage to help his mother. 

As Gohar likes to say, she is happy with her farm, she does her work with pleasure, and has great hope of gaining more profit from it. She has cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep, lamb and chickens. She says that she manages to sell her farm products (milk, meat, cheese and eggs) mainly to her regular customers from Sevan city. 

Land cultivation also demands great care and time and Gohar manages this as well. On her land she cultivates potatoes, greens and carrots, which she sells little by little from her house. She asked for this loan of 700,000 Armenian Drams to buy a cow and fodder for all her farm cattle with a plan of enlarging her farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Allanor

texts.en:
This is Allanor, who is 37 and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Bernie, a technician, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Allanor operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Allanor is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

Allanor dreams for her business to continue to grow and to have more sources of income. She hopes to give her family a good life in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional meat products to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin  is a 27-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and three kids in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. 

Yasmin requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity. Yasmin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She has had a retail shop for three years.

She will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize. She hopes this will help her to educate her children to college level. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her shop and educate her children well.

She has borrowed 10,000 KES, which she will repay in one year. Her monthly income is 6,000 KES, and she is in her second loan cyle.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize

loans.name: Xiomara Lissethe

texts.es:
Xiomara, está atendiendo mejor a sus clientes en el comedor, les puede ofrecer un variado menú a un precio accesible, esto es por la buena administración del financiamiento anterior, actualmente se mantiene trabajando sin ningún problema y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, carnes, condimentos, entre otros ingredientes para elaborar la comida que ofrece en su negocio, espera seguir teniendo buenas demandas para recuperar su inversión con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Xiomara, is serving customers better at her eatery, and can offer them a varied menu at an affordable price. This is because she managed the previous loan well. Currently she is continuing to work without any problems, and has been able to pay off her debts. 

She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy vegetables, basic staples, drinks, meats, condiments and other ingredients for making the meals she offers at her business. She hopes to continue having good demand so that she can recover her investment through improved earnings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, basic staples, drinks, meats, condiments and other ingredients for making the meals she offers at her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man, who has been working in selling fish since 2011. He is the sole breadwinner to four other members, where he puts so much effort to develop his business in a well managed way to make sure he can provide them with the necessary living needs.

Ahmad is a hard working man with a very good reputation in his region. At the beginning he started his current business from his house then moved it to a separate shop, where he is capable of attracting more customers and displaying diversified fish kinds to reply to different customers' requests.

Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's filed partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary refrigerators for his business development to keep his fish stored at a good temperature and increase his business capital.

He hopes to expand and develop his business more in the future to start wholesale trade.

loans.use: To buy necessary refrigerators for his business development to keep his fish stored at a good temperature

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mera is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis, and she has been in this business for six years.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and maize.

She works seven days a week, and her major business challenges include thieves and the seasonality of food. She aspires to buy a plot of land and start growing green bananas. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, and maize.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs.

Olivia is very positive that she could improve her business even more if you were to lend her 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to the purchase of additional inventory of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of the products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in a viable and sustainable business. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Olivia also operates and maintains a piggery and poultry business to earn additional profits. She dreams that her business will continue to flourish. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to both share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items needed for her store.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga, utilizo el préstamo anterior para comprar únicamente la materia prima para fortalecer la venta de comida, bebidas y tortillas, es así como continua generando ingresos para cubrir todos sus compromisos.
Está decidida a solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir en 6 qq de maíz para fortalecer la venta de tortillas y pupusas, espera tener buenos resultados como con la inversión anterior.
texts.en:
Santiaga used the previous loan to purchase only raw materials for strengthening her sales of food, beverages, and tortillas, and this is how she continues generating income to meet all her commitments.

She has decided to request a new loan in order to invest in six quintals of corn to strengthen her sales of tortillas and pupusas [stuffed tortillas], and she hopes to have good results, as with the previous loan.

loans.use: to invest in six quintals of corn to strengthen her sales of tortillas and pupusas [stuffed tortillas].

loans.name: Juan Mario

texts.es:
Juan, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos, tres personas dependen económicamente de él, no cuenta con apoyo del extranjero. Aprendió dentro de su familia a comercializar medicina y lo realiza de manera independiente desde hace 3 años, también ofrece artículos para limpieza, cuenta con clientes establecidos y su dificultad es la delincuencia.
El objetivo de solicitar un crédito es para comprar analgésicos, antibióticos, pomadas, etc., de esa manera surtirá su negocio y que sus clientes estén satisfechos, con la inversión  se mantendrá trabajando y generando los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Los sueños para Juan son remodelar su vivienda y dar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family, made up of his wife and their children, who depend on him financially as they do not have any other support.  He learned how to sell medications from his family, and he has been doing so independently for three years.  He also sells cleaning products.  He has a loyal clientele but he has issues with crime around his store.  

The goal of this loan is to purchase pain relievers, antibiotics, ointments, etc., in order to stock his store and satisfy his customers.  With this investment, he will be able to continue working and earning the income needed to get his family ahead.  Juan's dreams are to remodel his house and give his family a dignified life.

loans.use: purchase pain relievers, antibiotics, ointments, etc., in order to stock his store and satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 34-year-old married mother with three children. She is a Palestinian refugee who puts so much effort into supporting her husband and family members who are seeking a better living and education.

She requests a loan to pay for her children's tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students from low-income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

Sanaa hopes to continue to provide her children with the necessary living needs, and develop their living standard.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her three children.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of four sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Khaled wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all their needed stuff.

Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will provide the family clean water.

Khaled appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: Naem

texts.en:
Naem is a 50-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Naem wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all their needed stuff.

Naem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will provide the family clean water.

Naem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  This income barely covers all the family's needs. Eyad wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all their needed stuff.

Eyad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will provide the family clean water.

Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to add more milk supply to her customers and meet their demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a rural farmer in Nandihills, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is a mother of two and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her parents, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings.

"I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs," said Milkah. Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Milkah formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers.

Magdaline is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Milkah is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
This is Rosalia, 39 years old and resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, and together they have one child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosalia operates a food stall. She makes and sells snacks such as banana cue, a popular Philippine street snack food made of bamboo-skewered, deep-fried Saba bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. She is also a tricycle operator. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosalia is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil, and gas.

Rosalia wants to manage a mini-grocery store someday. She hopes to give her child a good future through all of her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients and raw materials needed to make more banana cue.

loans.name: José Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir, estudio hasta séptimo grado, luego decidió emigrar hacia los Estados Unidos, pero no pudo permanecer mucho tiempo alla, así que regreso a su país, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica solo al oficio doméstico, tiene solo un hijo de tres años de edad.

Vladimir, se dedica a la agricultura y también a la crianza de ganado desde hace ocho años; el lugar donde trabaja está a dos kilómetros desde su casa.

Vladimir, con el credito comprará cinco sacos de abono, veneno y pagara mano de obra para preparara la tierra donde sembrará.

Su sueño es, poder obtener buenas ganancias en el cultivo de maíz, para poder suplir las necesidades de su pareja y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Vladimir attended school until seventh grade.  He then moved to the United States but he was not able to stay there very long, and had to return to El Salvador.  He is married and his spouse is a homemaker.  They only have one son who is three years old.  Vladimir works in agriculture and also raises livestock, which he has been doing for eight year.  His workplace is two kilometers from his home.

With the requested loan, Vladimir will purchase five sacks of fertilizer, poison, and will pay for labor to prepare the land for planting.  His dream is to be able to earn enough through growing corn to provide for all of the needs of housewife and son.

loans.use: purchase five sacks of fertilizer, poison and to pay for labor to prepare his land for the planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase cement, lime, sand and iron to remodel his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Alaa wants to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the house. This will provide the family with clean water.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy African wax fabric and sell to customers.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 48 years old and lives with her husband in Tufashen village of the Shirak region. Their only occupation is the farming business. They cultivate wheat and barley, and gather income from selling the gathered harvest in the market. Both Armenuhi and her husband are looking to expand their farming business. To do so, Armenuhi has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of the agro machine (tractor) to enlarge the productivity of the farm.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and the living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs make a number of difficulties for people developing their business in the Shirak region.

Armenuhi's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Please help this hardworking woman with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the agro machine (tractor) to enlarge the productivity of the farm and gather more income for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Aisha sells charcoal at the market on both a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Aisha's major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from her village to the market to sell. 

Aisha lives in her own house, and the family has access to both piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Flower 50035 Group

texts.en:
Flower 50035 group is made up of four united hardworking members, who put so much effort in developing both their families' social and financial living. All of them decided to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to cover their business and family needs in a well managed way.

Najah is the group's featured borrower. She is a 39-year-old married mother of four children, who works hard to support her husband in covering their living needs and especially their education expenses. Najah has ten years of experience in hand crafts and selling beauty creams and cosmetics from her house. Her business is going on just fine, but needs additional external financial support to expand it properly.

Today, Najah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees. Najah is the second lady from the right.

As for the other group members, Jamal and Joumana both work as handmade artisans of souvenirs (13, 10 years of experience) and both of them will invest their loans to make necessary maintenance at home after the hard winter season. They are the first from the right and the first from the left respectively. As for Manal, she is the second from the left and is a married mother of two children who runs a grocery store in addition to being an employee in an elderly people care association. Her acquired loan portion will be invested in developing her store with special summer beverages.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
Ruperta es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, sin hijos y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Karhuiza’ situada a una altitud de 3,735 metros sobre el nivel del mar,  a una distancia de 65 km; a 1 hora, de la ciudad,  los pobladores son originarios de familias aimaras, La principal actividad económica de la población es la crianza de ganado vacuno; criollo como mejorado para la producción de leche y sus derivados, continua la producción agrícola; el cultivo de papa, habas, y quinua.
Ruperta es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la ganadería, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica, recibe agua de un estanque cercano y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de queso artesanal, dedicándose al cuidado diario del ganado para ordeñar la leche y producir queso. “mi negocio continúa creciendo, la demanda es mayor y necesito producir más cantidad de leche…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una experiencia de toda la vida para al producción de queso y eso hace que tenga clientes constantes, la desventaja es el clima del lugar que hace difícil la producción de leche. Su sueño es tener un establo amplio que brinde todas las comodidades para la producción de leche, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para su cría. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por ese motivo que Ruperta solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero para aumentar su producción de leche y de queso
texts.en:
Ruperta is a 44-year-old woman who is married and has no children.  Her business is the production and sale of handmade cheese.  She is enterprising, patient, a good listener, optimistic, responsible, and hard-working.  Her business is carried out in the town of Karhuiza, which is situated at an altitude of 3,735 meters above sea level and at a distance of 65 kilometers, or one hour, from the city.  Its inhabitants are originally from Aymara families.  The main economic activity of the population is raising cattle to better produce milk and its by-products, as well as continuing agricultural production like growing potatoes, beans, and quinoa.

Ruperta has brown skin, dark eyes, a short stature, and long dark hair that she wears in a braid.  She has a medium physique, and her way of dressing is traditional (sombrero, poncho, and skirt).  Ruperta's native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home, but she speaks Spanish in everyday life and for her work.  She carries out her life in the company of her husband who makes a living with livestock.  They live in their own home which is made of brick and has a corrugated roof and electricity.  They get water from a nearby reservoir, and do not have a sewage system.  

Ruperta's business is making handmade cheese.  She dedicates herself every day to caring for the cows in order to get the milk and produce cheese. "My business continues to grow.  The demand is greater and I need to produce a larger quantity of milk...", she says.  One perk of her business is that she has a lifetime of experience in producing cheese, and this means that she has constant customers.  A drawback is the weather of the place, which makes milk production difficult.  

Her dream is to have a large barn that provides all the amenities for milk production, and she wishes to purchase dairy cattle to raise.  This is her second cycle of loans with the institution in the 16 years that she has has this job.  This is what motivates Ruperta to ask for a loan to buy dairy cows to increase her production of milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase her production of milk and cheese.

loans.name: Cartonera Familiar Group

texts.es:
"Cartonera Familiar" es un grupo ubicado en una comunidad del Estado de México en la cual los habitantes se dedican a la cría de animales y al cultivo de la tierra, principalmente sembrando maíz.
A pesar de su edad, Doña Juana, una de las integrantes, mantiene su espíritu trabajador. A sus 63 años aún está involucrada en la actividad que aprendió de su esposo Manuel y que a ambos les permitió sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos, todos ellos independientes hoy en día. 
La pareja y dos de sus hijos se dedican a recolectar papel y cartón de desperdicio en grandes cantidades para producir láminas de cartón que revenden en la comunidad. Para obtener su producto necesitan remojar todo el material, moler la pasta y después hacen placas de 2x2 metros que dejan secar. Por último, las placas se petrolizan para garantizar mayor durabilidad, se empaquetan y están listas para vender. 
Hace 13 años Manuel aprendió a hacer las láminas en una fábrica de cartón y después de conocer bien el proceso, se aventuró a trabajar de manera independiente. El apoyo e interés de Doña Juana por aprender, los llevó a tener un negocio estable. A pesar de que las actividades de Juana han disminuido, ella sigue tendiendo una mano a Don Manuel. “Realmente me agrada estar dentro del taller ayudando en lo que pueda, me gusta ver todo el proceso y las láminas al final”. 
El microcrédito les ha ayudado a comprar la maquinaria y el material necesarios para mejorar su negocio: han comprado combustóleo, cartón cuando les hace falta, máquinas e incluso una camioneta para transportar su producto. 
Como siguiente paso, la familia tiene planeado buscar nuevos mercados, vender las láminas de cartón en otras comunidades a las que hasta ahora no han llegado. Para lograr su meta, necesitan seguir contando con apoyo financiero y esta vez solicitan un préstamo para comprar más combustóleo necesario para el acabado de sus láminas.  
*En la imagen: Don Juan, Doña Juana y una de sus hijas quien les ayuda en la producción de las láminas de cartón. Los tres integrantes del grupo posan en la fuente que es el punto central del jardín municipal donde viven.
texts.en:
"Cartonera Familiar" is a group located in a community in the State of Mexico where the people are engaged in raising animals, and cultivating the land, mainly planting corn.

Despite her age, Juana, one of the members, maintains her working spirit.  At 63, she is still involved in the activity she learned from her husband, Manuel, which allowed both of them to raise their four children, who are all independent now.

The couple and two of their children collect paper and cardboard from refuse in large quantities to produce cardboard sheets to re-sell in the community.  To make their product, they need to steep all the material in water, mix the resulting pulp, and later they press it into 2x2 meter sheets, and then let them dry.  Finally, they coat the sheets with paraffin to ensure durability, pack them, and then they are ready to sell.

Thirteen years ago, Manuel learned to make the sheets in a cardboard factory, and after becoming very familiar with the process, he ventured to work independently.  Juana’s support and interest in learning, led them to have a stable business.  Despite the fact that Juana’s activities have diminished, she continues lending a hand to Manuel.  “Actually, I really enjoy being in the workshop helping wherever I can. I like to see the whole process and the finished sheets”. 

The loan has helped them to purchase the machinery and the material needed to improve their business.  They have purchased paraffin, cardboard when they need it, machines, and even a small truck to transport their product.

As a next step, the family plans to seek new markets, and sell the cardboard sheets in other communities that they have not reached so far.  To achieve their goal, they need to continue to have financial support, and this time they are requesting a loan to purchase more paraffin, which they need to finish their sheets.

*In the image, are Juan, Juana, and one of their daughters who is helping them in the production of the cardboard sheets. The three members of the group are posing at the fountain, which is the focal point of the town garden where they live.

loans.use: to buy rollers and a press.

loans.name: Labar

texts.ru: Лабар, 50 лет, замужем, воспитывает 7 детей, 2 старшие дочери замужем. Образование-среднее. С 1983 года занимается животноводством. Бизнес начала с 1,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Лабар успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 коровы. Ежемесячная прибыль Лабар составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Дети помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Лабар планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Labar is 50 years old and married.  She is raising seven children; her two oldest daughters are already married.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1983.  She started her own business with 1,000 som (KGS).  Today, she successfully runs her own small farm and she owns two cows.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock.  Her children help her to run the household.  Labar is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania who is 48 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to John, her business partner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Epifania operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. However, it is considered a waste of money and time to spend on gas and cooking food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Epifania's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Epifania is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more product like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Epifania dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and supplies to make more of the breakfast meals she sells.

loans.name: Perush

texts.en:
This loan will help Perush to both cover cultivation costs as well as purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and fuel so she can earn more income for the family. 

Perush is a 37-year-old farmer who lives with her husband and 3 school-aged children. On her farm she keeps livestock of cow, sheep, and hens, and she also cultivates wheat, barley, and potatoes. Because cultivated products are mainly for her family's use, and very little is left for selling in the market, Perush needs to enlarge her cultivation works. And in order to do so, she is requesting this loan. 

The Shirak region, where she and her family live and work, is considered a poor region where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make up a number of difficulties for people to develop their businesses in the area. 

Perush's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them access markets and earn better livings.

loans.use: to cover cultivation costs and purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Akinai

texts.ru: Акинай 30 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. По характеру она очень добрая, веселая, трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 3 овцы, 2 коровы и 40 коз. Акинай получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Акинай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она мечтает купить новую мебель для дома.
texts.en: Akinai is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  By nature, she is a very kind, happy, goal-oriented and hardworking woman.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She has a nicely developed farm, which includes three sheep, two cows and 40 goats.  She makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her farming business.  She is also dreaming about buying new furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 25-year-old, single, ambitious man. He has been employed in a well-known company for three years, waiting for the suitable moment to start his own business in his educational domain.
He is an electronics expert and is working hard to open his own electronics sales and maintenance shop, but unfortunately he can't save the required capital to start his own business because of his required daily living needs.

Thus, Bilal is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to open his own shop selling and maintaining electronics. He will also plan for the possibility of resigning from his current job when his business income is high enough to cover his living needs.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his own business, and prove he is skilled enough in his domain.

loans.use: to open his own shop to sell and maintain electronics, and plan for the possibility of resigning from his current job when his business income is high enough.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros has faithfully repaid her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been engaged in buying and selling herbal medicines and food supplements for more than 13 years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all of her needs through her business, while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve her sales, Milagros is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities of coffee and herbal products so she can expand her product inventory. She also sells ready-to-wear clothing and direct sales products, and she plans to expand her inventory for this business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation in advance for this assistance.

In the future, Milagros hopes that she and her family will be financially secure. She dreams of both growing her business and being able to help provide for the education of her grandchildren. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

loans.use: to purchase for more stock of Vita Plus products and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 32, and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. Wool is used in making and knotting the blankets. There is no better kind of blanket than blankets made by hand, though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure, and he knots blankets overnight. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time.
